story:
*Version Française en bas de page*


How the idea came about

Hi!

We are Elise Billiard and Virginia Monteforte, two migrants having made Malta our home.

We probably met because we are both anthropologists deeply concerned with issues pertaining to migration. Living in Malta, in the centre of the Mediterranean, at the border of "fortress" Europe, we have had a privileged vantage point from which to view the changing social and political dynamics that have came about due to the  arrivals of boat people in Malta since 2001.

We faced the distress of asylum seekers landing in Malta after a gruelling journey, and we faced the reactions of fear and anger in casual conversations, in newspaper articles, and in the online comments sections of these same articles.

As migrants ourselves, we thought we could do something to balance out this ever-growing tension.

So, we wanted to show that as migrants, whether expatriates, refugees, third country nationals, undocumented asylum seekers or EU citizens we all have something in common. We wanted to dismantle the stereotypes that reduce the word 'migrant' to what is labelled as “illegal immigration”.

We are all newcomers, looking for a home. And in today's world, most of us are, or will be, migrants, even if it's just for a short period of our lives.

And so this was how RIMA was born...from the desire to hear all, and not just some, of our stories.


The RIMA Project in brief

RIMA is an anthropological and artistic project aiming at deconstructing the notion of mobility and immobility.


What does RIMA mean?

Rima* (n.f.)
plur. rimi

– Swell, wake made by a vessel in motion

– Rhyme

Rima is a Maltese word meaning the wake left behind by a boat on the surface of the sea. It evokes, then, something which happened in the past but whose effects we can still perceive in traces; a wire on the water which we can trace back to its origin. It also means, simply, ‘rhyme’ – the return of similar sounds though by different words.That’s why our project has this name. It aims to collect different narratives which however still originate from the same feeling of departure, detachment, settlement’s desire.

* thanks go to poet Adrian Grima for suggesting the title.


The actions

The RIMA project has three actions: a film festival, a theatrical adaptation of the stories collected by us and the publication of a book of these same stories.


1- The film festival was a great success last November (and we hope to organise more in the years to come!). You can read more about this first strand of the Rima project, by clicking here: https://rimaprojectblog.wordpress.com/filmfesti...



2- The theatrical adaptation of the stories collected will be held on the 26th and 27th of February 2016. A team of professional actors has been working with non-professional and foreign actors, under the supervision and following the inspiration of theatre director Marcelle Teuma.



3- We need your help to complete the last part of our project: the writing and publication of our book which will retrace the inspiring journeys of the 20 people we interviewed last year. We intend to launch the book at the end of May 2016 and deliver it to you at the beginning of June 2016.



What we need and what you get

We need 1,365€ to be able to design and print the 200 copies of our the RIMA book. In addition we need 135€ to cover the extra fees that Indiegogo and PayPal require. This is why we are asking for 1,500€.

The project as a whole has been endorsed and partially funded by The Malta Art Funds; Malta arts Council and the Valletta 2018 Foundation. The film festival also enabled  the general public to come and support our efforts by paying for a festival ticket. But now  we find ourselves in need of extra help to complete the book. The book will be an original publication of the stories we collected, with an unconventional design and unique binding. We are working on it at this very moment.

In the coming weeks, we will be posting our progress and you will be able to see the book grow!


The Impact

Sharing the stories that we, migrants, carry with us is a first step to enable discussion. Today in Malta there are quite a few journalists speaking about the migrant issue, but still very little has been done with migrants. Most photographs, most literature is done on migrants. But what we are doing (Virginia and Elise) is something with migrants. There is no "us" and "them".

We believe that through this simple project we can help people in Malta and outside of Malta, convince themselves that migration is a common situation, which is extensively demanding and increasingly widespread.

What does it mean to be a migrant? Are we always moving when we are reduced to the identity of "migrant"? When do we cease do be migrants and become a locals? Is it just a matter of legal recognition or is it implying also, and above all, a deeper, affective, long-term awareness about this new place that we can call home? What is home for you?

“The ideal place for me is one in which it feels most natural to live as a stranger”, the Italian author Calvino stresses in Hermit in Paris, reminding us how “home” is never a concept at rest, and its walls and grounds are far wider and multifaceted than we may believe.

Supporting this project means supporting the idea that everyone has the right to be heard, locals or foreigners.

Supporting RIMA is considering that once a migrant finds his/her home, he is not a migrant anymore. So what is he/she then?
A settler?
 
Supporting RIMA is also accepting the idea to be surprised by what you will be discovering in this book. Because each story is unique.

                       



Risks and challenges

Speaking about migration today is not an easy thing. However our background in anthropology, sociology and literature, as much as our deep comprehension of the Maltese society, has enable us to carefully choose our words and to listen with attention to the multitude of stories that have been generously given to us.

This is a political project because discussing urgent and hotly debated issues is always political. But the RIMA project is not affiliated to any political party, and neither are we. (Elise Billiard and Virginia Monteforte as project managers).


Other ways to support Rima

We would be grateful if you could spread the word around...our project needs all the exposure it can get.

You can use Indiegogo's tools to make it easier to spread the word!


Perks

- The original RIMA Book, of course! 18€

-Get a personalized version!
The RIMA book with a handwritten special dedication by the 2 authors. 30€

-Be part of the book!
The RIMA book with your name printed in the thankyou page. 40€

-Looking for migrant postcards?

An original idea to send a postcard from Malta.

Sending a migrant postcard is not only a poetic gesture, it is also sending a clear message about migration all around the world.

The postcard will be illustrated with photographs taken during the project.  (such as photographs of personal objects owned by migrants, photographs of the theatrical performance, film stills from migrant films...). 20€


- A nice memory to put on the wall?

A nice memory to put on the wall? You can choose one of the 2 Rima posters:

-poster of the Rima Migrant film festival (November 2015)


-poster of the Rima Theatrical adaptation (February 2016)

10€ (each poster, including shipping). Careful - there is a limited number! These posters might become a collector's item! 


- The Prestige edition
Keep in touch for updates on this edition! soon coming.
This is the hand bound edition with fine grain paper and hours of meticulous work at out workshop under our little fingers!
A beautiful "book-object", not just a book. 60€


-This is the unique original mock-up book.
A pure product of craft and care. With fine paper, hard bound and hand bound and boxed.
Keep in touch for updates on this edition! soon coming. 300€
    

                



- And last but not least:
All the above items, including shipping: 80€
(the RIMA book with your name written in the thankyou page, AND the special handwritten dedication from the authors, the 5 postcards, and the 2 posters)


++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
Version Française (abrégée):

Bonjour !

Nous sommes Elise Billiard et Virginia Monteforte, deux migrantes ayant fait de Malte notre foyer.

Nous nous sommes probablement rencontrées parce que nous sommes deux anthropologues profondément concernées par les questions se rapportant à la migration. Vivant à Malte, dans le centre de la Méditerranée, à la frontière de "la forteresse" de l'Europe, nous sommes à un poste d'observation privilégié pour voir la dynamique sociale et politique changeante en raison des arrivées de boat people à Malte depuis 2001.

Nous avons fait face à la détresse de demandeurs d'asile atterrissant à Malte après un voyage exténuant et nous avons fait face aux réactions de crainte et la colère dans des conversations occasionnelles, dans des articles de presse et dans les sections de commentaires en ligne de ces mêmes articles.

En tant que migrantes, nous avons pensé que nous pourrions faire quelque chose pour compenser cette tension toujours croissante.

Ainsi, nous avons voulu montrer que comme les migrants, les expatriés, les réfugiés, les ressortissants de pays tiers (hors EU), les demandeurs d'asile "sans papiers" ou les citoyens de l'Union européenne, tous ont quelque chose en commun. Nous avons voulu déconstruire les stéréotypes qui réduisent le mot 'le migrant' à ce qui est étiqueté comme "immigration illégale".

Nous sommes tous des nouveaux venus, cherchant une maison. Et dans le monde d'aujourd'hui, la plupart d'entre nous sont, ou seront, des migrants, même si c'est juste pendant une période courte de nos vies.

Voilà comment est né RIMA... de nos histoires, et du désir d'entendre TOUS et non juste certains.

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous recevrez.

Nous avons besoin de 1 365€ pour l'édition et l'impression de 200 copies du livre RIMA. Les 135€ restant serviront à payer les frais de service requis par Indiegogo et Paypal. Voilà pourquoi nous demandons 1500€

Le projet RIMA, avec son festival de films de migrants, sa pièce de théatre et la collecte de témoignages a été en grande partie soutenu par le Malta Art Funds et par la fondation Valletta2018. Le public qui est venu nombreux au festival et à la représentation théatrale a également apporté un soutien financié.

Mais a présent, nous avons besoin d'une dernière aide pour publier un livre qui rendra compte avec subtilité des témoignages qui nous ont été confiés.

Le livre sera une publication originale, avec une mise en page artistique. En plus des 200 copies, nous publierons également une vingtaine de livres reliés à la main.

Nous travaillons dès à présent à la confection du livre, dont la première étape et la sélection des extraits de témoignages et la décision de la structure générale du livre.

Restez en contact pour en savoir plus ! Nous mettrons à jour cette page indiegogo (ainsi que le blog et la page facebook).

En espérant que vous soutiendrez notre projet.

Et n'oubliez pas, partager c'est déjà aider !

*Version Française en bas de page*

How the idea came about


Hi!
We are Elise Billiard and Virginia Monteforte, two migrants having made Malta our home.
We probably met because we are both anthropologists deeply concerned 
with issues pertaining to migration. Living in Malta, in the centre of 
the Mediterranean,
at the border of "fortress" Europe, we have had a privileged vantage 
point from which to view the changing social and political dynamics that
 have came about due to the  arrivals of boat people in Malta since 2001. 
We faced the distress of asylum seekers landing in Malta after a gruelling journey, and we faced the reactions of fear and anger in casual conversations, in newspaper articles, and in the online comments sections of these same articles. 
As migrants ourselves, we thought we could do something to balance out this ever-growing tension.
So, we wanted to show that as migrants, whether expatriates, refugees, third country nationals, undocumented asylum seekers or EU citizens we all have something in common. We wanted
to dismantle the stereotypes that reduce the word 'migrant' to what is labelled
as “illegal immigration”. 
We are all newcomers, looking for a home. And in today's world, most of us are, or will be, migrants, even if it's just for a short period of our lives.
And so this was how RIMA was born...from the desire to hear all, and not just some, of our stories.


The RIMA Project in brief

RIMA is an anthropological and
artistic project aiming at deconstructing the notion of mobility and
immobility.


What does RIMA mean?


Rima* (n.f.)
plur. rimi
– Swell, wake made by a vessel in motion
– Rhyme
Rima is a Maltese word meaning the wake left behind by a boat on the 
surface of the sea. It evokes, then, something which happened in the 
past but whose effects we can still perceive in traces; a wire on the 
water which we can trace back to its origin. It also means, simply, 
‘rhyme’ – the return of similar sounds though by different words.That’s
 why our project has this name. It aims to collect different narratives 
which however still originate from the same feeling of departure, 
detachment, settlement’s desire.
* thanks go to poet Adrian Grima for suggesting the title.

The actions
The RIMA project has three actions: a film festival, a theatrical adaptation of the stories collected by us and the publication of a book of these same stories.

1- The film festival was a great success last November (and we hope to organise more in the years to come!). You can read more about this first strand of the Rima project, by clicking here: https://rimaprojectblog.wordpress.com/filmfesti...





2- The theatrical adaptation of the stories collected will be held on the 26th and 27th of February 2016. A team of professional actors has been working with non-professional and foreign actors, under the supervision and following the inspiration of theatre director Marcelle Teuma.




3- We need your help to complete the last part of our project: the writing 
and publication of our book which will retrace the inspiring journeys of
 the 20 people we interviewed last year. We intend to launch the book at the end of May 2016 and deliver it to you at the beginning of June 2016.








What we need and what you get


We need 1,365€ to be able to design and print the 200 copies of our the RIMA book. In addition we need 135€ to cover the extra fees that Indiegogo and PayPal require. This is why we are asking for 1,500€.
The project as a whole has been endorsed and partially funded by The Malta Art Funds; Malta arts Council and the Valletta 2018 Foundation. The film festival also enabled  the general public to come and support our efforts by paying for a festival ticket. But now  we find ourselves in need of extra help to complete the book. The book will be an original publication of the stories we collected, with an unconventional design and unique binding. We are working on it at this very moment.
In the coming weeks, we will be posting our progress and you will be able to see the book grow!


The Impact
Sharing the stories that we, migrants, carry with us is a first step to enable discussion. Today in Malta there are quite a few journalists speaking about the migrant issue, but still very little has been done with migrants. Most photographs, most literature is done on migrants. But what we are doing (Virginia and Elise) is something with migrants. There is no "us" and "them".
We believe that through this simple project we can help people in Malta and outside of Malta, convince themselves that migration is a common situation, which is extensively demanding and increasingly widespread. 
What does it mean to be a migrant? Are we always moving when we are reduced to the identity of "migrant"? When do we cease do be migrants and become a locals? Is it just a matter of legal recognition or is it implying also, and above all, a deeper, affective, long-term awareness about this new place that we can call home? What is home for you?
“The ideal place for me is one in which it feels most natural to live as a stranger”, the Italian author Calvino stresses in Hermit in Paris,
 reminding us how “home” is never a concept at rest, and its walls and 
grounds are far wider and multifaceted than we may believe.Supporting this project means supporting the idea that everyone has the right to be heard, locals or foreigners.Supporting RIMA is considering that once a migrant finds his/her home, he is not a migrant anymore. So what is he/she then?A settler? Supporting RIMA is also accepting the idea to be surprised by what you will be discovering in this book. Because each story is unique.                        

Risks and challenges
Speaking about migration today is not an easy thing. However our background in anthropology, sociology and literature, as much as our deep comprehension of the Maltese society, has enable us to carefully choose our words and to listen with attention to the multitude of stories that have been generously given to us.This is a political project because discussing urgent and hotly debated issues is always political. But the RIMA project is not affiliated to any political party, and neither are we. (Elise Billiard and Virginia Monteforte as project managers).

Other ways to support Rima
We would be grateful if you could spread the word around...our project needs all the exposure it can get.
You can use Indiegogo's tools to make it easier to spread the word!


Perks
- The original RIMA Book, of course! 18€-Get a personalized version!The RIMA book with a handwritten special dedication by the 2 authors. 30€-Be part of the book!The RIMA book with your name printed in the thankyou page. 40€-Looking for migrant postcards?An original idea to send a postcard from Malta.
Sending a migrant postcard is not only a poetic gesture, it is also sending a clear message about migration all around the world.
The postcard will be illustrated with photographs taken during the project.  (such as photographs of personal objects owned by migrants, photographs of the theatrical performance, film stills from migrant films...). 20€
- A nice memory to put on the wall?A nice memory to put on the wall? You can choose one of the 2 Rima posters:

-poster of the Rima Migrant film festival (November 2015)



-poster of the Rima Theatrical adaptation (February 2016)


10€ (each poster, including shipping). Careful - there is a limited number! These posters might become a collector's item! 

- The Prestige editionKeep in touch for updates on this edition! soon coming.This is the hand bound edition with fine grain paper and hours of meticulous work at out workshop under our little fingers! A beautiful "book-object", not just a book. 60€-This is the unique original mock-up book. A pure product of craft and care. With fine paper, hard bound and hand bound and boxed.Keep in touch for updates on this edition! soon coming. 300€                      
- And last but not least:All the above items, including shipping: 80€(the
 RIMA book with your name written in the thankyou page, AND the special 
handwritten dedication from the authors, the 5 postcards, and the 2 
posters)++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++Version Française (abrégée):

story:
“I Am Home!” will help children who are experiencing grief understand where their loved one have gone. I wrote this poem because of, and in honor of, my mother who passed away a year ago. I miss her so much, but it helps me to remember that she’s in a place where she is happier than I can even comprehend. My hope is that “I am Home!” helps children find comfort in the knowledge that their loved ones are safe and happy.

I taught elementary school for 28 years and have seen dozens of children experience loss during this time. It’s not easy for them to understand death and the afterlife, and there are very few books that effectively provide them with comfort during that time. “I Am Home!” is intended to fill this void in literature and to help children find comfort when they need it most.

Though I have published several stories in the Chicken Soup for the Soul series, this is my first free standing publication. Funding raised here will help cover the cost of publication and the first round of printing. My intention is that this book get into the hands of as many children as possible and will be donating many books to hospitals and hospice facilities.

Your generosity will help spread comfort to children when they need it most. Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

I am a guy born in Nebraska. After many years of traveling and some that might be considered difficult, it took 25 years since birth to be comfortable sharing my experiences through life in writings. I have a background in physical labor, technical work with my hands, and even tried a little of the sales life but who wants to be there forever? Writing has been a type of therapy for me already and I hope to provide that same sense, in any measure big or small, to people reading as an indirect goal to writing. I want to provide the world with a much lighter, relateable and more understandable definition of what it means to be weird.

What We Need & What You Get

Any money raised through here will be put towards a website first and foremost, it will provide a way to share works that I want to be available to the public, at least to the community of people that want it. This will include site setup, maintenance costs, etc. I can make that happen with a few hundred dollars. I have to set my dog a limit of no more than $30 for dog treats though so please keep requests meant for him to a minimum, he struggles with his weight sometimes but we are working together to remain active and healthy. His name is Dually. He follows his dream of one day being able to sniff all the dog butts in the world. I think it would mean a lot to him, he only speaks in whines, ruffs and paw slaps though so I can only guess. I will send you a custom dog picture upon request. Also available upon request, I will do a handwritten letter if you share a little about yourself, if you want a postcard about corn and more corn, I can also provide. Maybe a cow will sneak into the picture and you can get the full view of Nebraska in one go. If I don't reach my goal I will continue to write regardless, the effects on my personal being are great enough that I will pursue it in my spare time regardless. I know you want more than that from me so show me how much you think I should give up my day job. I will take a list of all donors and provide the link upon creation. Give me some content suggestions to create and I'll do it just for you.

The Impact

It's a way to share my secrets to the world, I don't care to keep them any longer. I have always felt that they were to be shared, not locked up forever. I have never attempted any project like this but I don't give up on my dreams. Some other hobbies that turned into successes of mine personally would be gardening, climbing, volunteering as an able body to set up events that otherwise wouldn't have the funding and many other things that I don't have space to list on here, but ask and I will always be glad to inform.

Risks & Challenges

There's always a chance that someone steals my work. I want to keep this from happening, by doing things the proper way. That way I can turn it into something sustainable, if I have no legs to stand on then I won't be able to devote more time to the craft, and from what I hear so far, that would be just a darn shame. This is where a website comes into play, it gives me a way to put out my free works without losing them forever to the first person who wishes to put their name on it. Eventually I want to be seen by a publisher face-to-face, or however the interactions with publishers go. Hopefully they don't demand Spiderman pictures but that's a risk I am willing to take. Worst case scenario, I still write, put my own money into it and be the sole proprietor, things here will help speed up the process I already have in mind.

Other Ways You Can Help

Read my work and provide feedback of any kind. Tell someone you know who may also appreciate such things or will be a good critic. The more people I know that want to even read my works, the more I can justify devoting my time and money to y'all. Give me your favorite topic and I'm positive that I had plans to write about it already, that will just fast-track it.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
White Stag Investing Crowdfunding Campaign

Campaign Summary

White Stag Investing is launching a Crowdfunding Initiative to finance its independent and authentic research in water investments!

After 7 years in the investment world learning the in-and-outs of Finance, I’ve spent the last two years researching the most pressing water problems societies are facing and how they are linked to financial opportunity and stability.

I have researched the solutions that have the better chances of fixing these issues and how they are generational opportunities for investors to participate in their financing.

I am now compiling all my research in a series of notes, books and analyses. I am launching a crowdfunding campaign to finance the deployment of this research over the next 24 months.

There are two ways for participating: Direct Support and Early-Access.

Direct Support

The Direct Support way is meant to support the independence and the authenticity of the research, through the publishing of regular notes on Linkedin. There several direct contributions possibilities depending on a contributor’s size: Personal, Professional and Institutional.

The Personal Support selection for anyone willing to support my research on a small contribution basis: CHF 10. Every personal contribution will also get a mention in my upcoming book Holy Water: How to Invest in Water and in the Future.

If you are an investment or water professional interesting in supporting my research showing how the economic and investment landscape is changing from climate change and its new water risks, there is a Professional Support possibility: CHF100. Every professional contribution will also get a special mention in my upcoming book Holy Water: How to Invest in Water and in the Future.

If you are a financial institution, NGO or an investor that wants to understand the bigger picture of how the economy and assets are linked to water, how financial flows will evolve throughout Climate Change financing and can be redirected to support water infrastructures and innovations, there is an Institutional Support possibility: CHF1000. Every professional contribution will also get a major mention in my upcoming book Holy Water: How to Invest in Water and in the Future.

E-Books and Research Early-Access

E-Books

The research will also feature two e-books: Stories in #Water, #Sustainability and #Investing and Holy Water the Book: How to Invest in Water and in The Future.

Stories in #Water, #Sustainability and #Investing is available now for the price of CH20 a piece and contains 111 of the best stories I’ve written on LinkedIn over the last two years. This is a set of stories on how to find value in water and sustainability and approach the new investment landscape throughout Climate Change. Climate Change will reshape the face of the Earth and with it any investment considerations. It is important to get an idea of how.

Holy Water the Book: How to Invest in Water and in The Future will follow my Holy Water Investment Series on Linkedin and talk in a deeper sense of how climate change is affecting modern economies through its water-related woes, how this will require new solutions to bring them up to speed to the environmental reality, and make for generational opportunities for investors to invest in new water infrastructures and innovations.

The first four chapters are now available on Linkedin:

Chapter 1: A Long Trend discusses the long-term economics of water and how this becomes a long-term investment opportunity to invest in its solutions.

Chapter 2: A Place of its Own discusses how considering water in your portfolio construction makes long-term investment sense.

Chapter 3: A Source of Value discusses the different industries involved in water and how they are all sources of singular opportunities in the wake of Climate Change.

Chapter 4: The New Testament discusses how systematic change is upon water systems to face new pollution and climate threats, what are the new innovations to prepare them against these risks and how these become generational opportunities for investors to finance them.

The next (tentative) chapters are:

Chapter 5: The New Map

Chapter 6 :The  Ark

Chapter 7: The Bottom of the Pyramid

Chapter 8: Unclogging the Watersheds

Chapter 9: From your Neighbourhood

Chapter 10: The First (and Last) Assets

Chapter 11: The Divine Intervention

Chapter 12: The Natural Design

Chapter 13: The Entire Chain

Chapter 14: A Match Made in Heaven

This book will be available when it is finished. Tentative target release: Q4 2022.

Early-Access to White Stag Investing Research:

I’m compiling also all my research in a set of market and companies analyses for investors to understand how they can access the Water Trade.

The Market Analyses will feature peer-group analyses along the different segments of the water value chain: Start-Ups, Venture Capital / Private Equity, Stocks and Public Equities Funds. They will give a sense of the differentiation within each sub-space of the value chain and how they are a source of opportunities for investors.

The company analyses will be a set of ESG-integrated investment analysis of selected companies by White Stag Investing. They will explain how these companies are likely to benefits from climate adaption needs along the Transition in general.

The crowdfunding campaign offers a set of respectively 5 and 10 coupons for the market and companies analyses at a 25% discount rate. Take yours while it last!

It is important to get an idea of how.Holy Water the Book: How to Invest in Water and in The Future will follow my Holy Water Investment Series on Linkedin and talk in a deeper sense of how climate change is affecting modern economies through its water-related woes, how this will require new solutions to bring them up to speed to the environmental reality, and make for generational opportunities for investors to invest in new water infrastructures and innovations.The first four chapters are now available on Linkedin:Chapter 1: A Long Trend discusses the long-term economics of water and how this becomes a long-term investment opportunity to invest in its solutions.Chapter 2: A Place of its Own discusses how considering water in your portfolio construction makes long-term investment sense.Chapter 3: A Source of Value discusses the different industries involved in water and how they are all sources of singular opportunities in the wake of Climate Change.Chapter 4: The New Testament discusses how systematic change is upon water systems to face new pollution and climate threats, what are the new innovations to prepare them against these risks and how these become generational opportunities for investors to finance them.The next (tentative) chapters are:Chapter 5: The New Map Chapter 6 :The  ArkChapter 7: The Bottom of the PyramidChapter 8: Unclogging the WatershedsChapter 9: From your NeighbourhoodChapter 10: The First (and Last) AssetsChapter 11: The Divine InterventionChapter 12: The Natural DesignChapter 13: The Entire ChainChapter 14: A Match Made in HeavenThis book will be available when it is finished. Tentative target release: Q4 2022.Early-Access to White Stag Investing Research:I’m compiling also all my research in a set of market and companies analyses for investors to understand how they can access the Water Trade.The Market Analyses will feature peer-group analyses along the different segments of the water value chain: Start-Ups, Venture Capital / Private Equity, Stocks and Public Equities Funds. They will give a sense of the differentiation within each sub-space of the value chain and how they are a source of opportunities for investors.The company analyses will be a set of ESG-integrated investment analysis of selected companies by White Stag Investing. They will explain how these companies are likely to benefits from climate adaption needs along the Transition in general.The crowdfunding campaign offers a set of respectively 5 and 10 coupons for the market and companies analyses at a 25% discount rate. Take yours while it last!

story:
Railway Station Press

Railway Station Press is a small nonfiction book publishing company based in Alexandria, Virginia. It started out as a letterpress print shop but turned to publishing books, playing cards, notecards, and postcard sets. We have published 14 books since 2017 and our latest is "Hiroshige's Fifty-three Stations of the Tokaido Road on Japanese Stamps, 1958 to 2019" which will be available in April.

Above is the first woodblock print of the series and is called "Nihonbashi." The 53 stations represent views and stopping places on the old Tokaido Road from Edo (now Tokyo) the business capital, to Kyoto where the Emperor had his palace. In the early 1830's Hiroshige was invited on the journey from Edo to Kyoto and made sketches. When he returned home he produced 55 paintings that were made into woodblocks. These images are in the public domain.

We need your help in raising the funds to be able to publish a minimum number of postcard sets or decks which will be printed by Shuffled Ink of Orlando, Florida. Last year we had Shuffled Ink do two different sets of playing cards of our design. I am able to do this using Adobe Photoshop, InDesign, and Illustrator on our Mac Pro. Shuffled Ink is family owned and does a very professional job of card printing. In this case the postcards will be 4 by 6 inches and the set will come shrink wrapped.

Utagawa Hiroshige, shown above, lived from 1797 to 1858. The beauty and popularity of his woodblock prints were a result of his portrayal of landscapes in all of the seasons and in all weather. He has captured the streaking rain, the heavy snowfall, the windy day that blows the hat off of a traveler, and the hot summer days. Vincent Van Gogh was heavily influenced by Hiroshige's work and the 53 Stations of the Tokaido Road have become very popular in the West.

Japan last published postcards of these woodblocks back in the 1960's and the USSR issued a series about the same time, but those are hard to find. It is time to publish a new set of these postcards that would be suitable for framing, mailing, or as flashcards.

story:
10-Year-Old Children's book author Emma Phipps is writing and self-publishing her third book in less than two years!

This newest book is about Pit Bull Awareness and changing the social conversation about this misunderstood breed. Emma wants to help to get Pit Bulls out of the animal shelters and into loving homes by teaching kids and adults alike through her stories and beautiful pictures about how wonderful and loving Pit Bulls can be!

 

Emma LOVES helping animals and teaching others about the importance of animal adoption! You can see the good she has done spreading the word on her blog at: www.FantasticTails.com/Blog

 

More About 10-Year-Old Author Emma Phipps and Her Books:

Emma's dog Nala is the main character of her first two fun books that show how awesome having a rescue dog can be! In her first book, Emma told the story about how she adopted and saved her older pregnant rescue dog Nala from being alone and homeless without a family to call her own! In Emma's second book, "Nala's Dog Training Adventure!" Nala is again the main character and this time we show that you CAN teach an older rescue dog new tricks!

Emma has already published two high-quality children's books called "Nala's Adoption Adventure!" and "Nala's Dog Training Adventure!" that teaches children and adults about the importance of animal rescue and adoption. The great thing about these books is that they are entertaining for the kids and adults reading them while also teaching about animals that may otherwise be forgotten!

Emma has been featured on the front page of our local newspaper "The Register-Guard" and she has also read her book at the local Eugene Public Library, Greenhill Humane Society, and also at schools! She has been on two local newscasts and also made an appearance on the radio!

*If you would like to see our documented journey of writing and self-publishing our first book you can watch the Youtube playlist at: www.FantasticTails.com/BookJourney

 

About Our Indiegogo Campaign:

This Indiegogo is to help us make our NEW BOOK about Pit Bull awareness (title to be determined)! In this new book, we follow along with the story of a Pit Bull who was the runt of a litter that was discarded by a backyard breeder. This kind-hearted and misunderstood dog lives much of his life in the animal shelter where he grows to be big and strong. One day a man who had Pit Bulls while he was growing up saw how sweet this loving dog was and took him home to become a part of his family!

This book shows that our sweet Pit Bull main character is misunderstood by others who assume the worst about Pit Bulls. There will be many situations where he is doing fun-loving things while other people are wrongly judging him by his looks and the negative stereotype of his breed.

 

With the money we will earn through this Indiegogo we will do the following:

1. Pay to have all illustrations made for this book including:

Front and back covers

Title page

Artwork for advertisements and marketing for this book.

2. Compensate people for their work in the book (editing, layout, etc.)

3. Purchase Proofs of the book once the first draft is completed to do final edits.

Once the above items have been paid for we will use additional funds for the following:

1. Pay for marketing to spread the word about our new book!

Facebook Ads.

Youtube Ads.

Google Ads.

2. Purchase books in bulk that we can give away to waiting rooms where children can find them and learn about the importance of animal adoption! Places such as:

Veterinary Offices.

Dentist Offices.

Animal Shelters.

Hospitals and Doctors Offices.

Anywhere We can share the word about helping animals (Young AND Old!) through adoption!

3. Create branded "Fantastic Tails" products for our wonderful readers and their pets!

4. Have money to allow Emma and Uncle Rob to travel to events where they can learn new ways to spread Emma's message to others!

 

Get Cool Perks While Helping Teach About Pit Bulls!

We have MANY cool perks that you can receive when you back our Indiegogo campaign! You can:

  • Get books signed by the author (and her dog)!
  • Original Proof Print of the Book!
  • Have your name (or business name!) in the book.
  • Have your dog illustrated in the book!
  • And SO MANY OTHER COOL THINGS!

Please check out our "Perks" page to see all the options that are still available!

 

What We Aim To Accomplish With This Book:

Emma is on a mission to help get Pit Bulls out of the animal shelters by education young and old through this beautiful and engaging children's book! She wants to help other people know how wonderful and nice Pit Bulls are and that they are great family dogs even though people have wrong ideas about them. Emma wants to stand up for the Pit Bull breed that has had a bad wrap and can't stand up for themselves by educating society through story, facts, and beautiful pictures! Please help us to get the Pit Bulls out of the animal shelters and into loving homes where they belong by backing out Indiegogo!

 

Risks and challenges

We realize that there can be risks involved when funding someone on Indiegogo. While we understand that people may think there is some chance that this book may not be completed, our track record of creating and publishing our first two books in approximately 3 months should put any concerns to rest. Also, we are currently working on this book in the background and are beyond the framework of the story and are currently having some of the illustrations started (as you can see in the picture for our Indiegogo).

Our biggest concern is that people who win rewards do not supply us with their information and/or pictures quickly so that we can have this project done in the time we expect. We will have cut-off times for people to send us their information that will be added to the book so that we can keep from having procrastinators highjacking our book and ultimately our success in accomplishing our goals!


Other Ways You Can Help!

We understand that not everyone is able to help by backing our campaign financially but we want you to know you can STILL HELP! :) Please share about this Indiegogo campaign in your community, at animal shelters, on social media, and anywhere and to anyone that LOVES Pit Bulls and want them to have loving forever homes! 

Please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out online to friends, family, companies, and social media influencers that love animals (especially Pit Bulls and rescue/adopted animals)! We appreciate your help in getting the word out and we thank you for anything you can do to support this young authors dream to help animals who can't help themselves!

story:
Help get this much-needed book into the hands of children and important programs that support them! 

Hey there! I'm Jennifer Gladen - author, teacher, and mom. I'm so excited to share with you about Angel Donor, an important fictional story featuring Olivia, born with the liver disease Biliary Atresia, who is in need of a liver transplant. 

 

Inspired by my own daughter's fight with Biliary Atresia,  Angel Donor is a heartwarming story designed to prepare, inspire, and bring hope to children in need of this surgery. 

This is a scary time for children in this situation, and Angel Donor helps get them ready for things that happen at the time of transplant. 

The Heart of the Story

Olivia never asked to have a disease like Biliary Atresia. It made her liver sick and now only a transplant will make her better. After waiting several months and close to losing hope, she gets the call she’s been waiting for. The journey of her life is about to begin.

It is a Message of Hope

When waiting for a transplant, the wait is daunting. It is easy to lose hope.  Angel Donor emphasizes the power of not giving up. 

 

It is a Message of Inspiration

"Why me," is often a question the child may have. They may feel like they have no control of the situation. Angel Donor inspires the reader by offering some ways to utilize what control they do have.

It is a Message of Preparation

The biggest question a child may have when preparing for a transplant is, "What will I experience?"  Without getting too technical, Angel Donor shows what some of the experiences may be at the time of transplant. It helps them anticipate what to expect.

How Will We Get the Story into the Hands of Children?

  • First, the book needs to be published. Pre-Ordering your copy here will make this possible.
  • Next, the book will be available in hardcover, paperback, and digital forms for purchase.
  • Most importantly, with your help,  we will be able to provide some copies to the Child Life Program at A.I. duPont Hospital for Children and STAR Kids Organization with copies of Angel Donor

 

What do the Child Life and STAR Kids Programs Do?

  • Child Life is a special program in many children's hospitals that help children cope with medical procedures during their hospital stay. 
  •  STAR Kids stands for Support Transplant And Recovery. They provide much-needed support for the needs of children during their transplant and their long-term care. They offer things such as resources, toiletries, activities, and more. With your help in publishing Angel Donor,  I can add this book to their list. 

Angel Donor is inspired by my daughter, Jacqueline, who was born with the rare liver disease, Biliary Atresia. By the time she was four, she received two liver transplants due to this disease. 

When we were preparing for her transplant, I wanted a book that would help her know what to expect. This is the driving force behind Angel Donor. Together, we can bring awareness about this disease and transplantation, while preparing, inspiring, and bringing hope to children in this situation.

Angel Donor was originally published in 2012 by Guardian Angel Publishing until they closed in 2020. As a mom with two children who needed an organ transplant, I knew I couldn't let this book go. Now, I am publishing the second edition independently.

story:
"Look into a mirror and what do you see? A fierce storm raging within yourself." (from A Brief Account of Sorcery by Robert Metlock)


The book cover:



What is Fierce Winds Rising?

Rather than repeat myself here, you can find out more about the novel on: http://www.fiercewindsrising.com. Check out the samples from the novel, and please feel free to leave comments on the website. When the novel is completed, I will post a few chapters on the website for everyone to read.

Fierce Winds Rising is a fantasy novel inspired by my favorite fantasy novels, movies, and video games. It is a compilation of all the stories, experiences, and wild imaginings locked up in my head; some are wonderful, most are funny, and a few are disturbing ;). It is the biggest project I have ever tackled outside of my professional career, and it has given me a newfound respect for authors, especially of the epic fantasy genre.

My favorite fantasy novels include The Dark Elf Trilogy by Salvatore, The Dragonlance Chronicles by Weis and Hickman, and of course, A Song of Ice and Fire series by Martin, which was what really nudged me to write a novel. My favorite fantasy movies are too many to mention, but I'll name a few. I was entranced by Willow when I first saw it in the late '80s. I was too young to see the original Star Wars Trilogy when it first came out, but I remember being obsessed with them during the early '90s when people watched the original cuts on VCR and not the current CGI-enhanced versions. I also watched The Princess Bride over and over again (who didn't?). As for the more recent movies, Pan's Labyrinth, Stardust, and Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon come to mind.

About the Project

I started writing Fierce Winds Rising in October, 2012. I have gone through a round of personal editing, and currently, the entire book is around 134,000 words. I expect it to be 135,000+ words when editing is finished. For comparison, Hunger Games is 100,000 words, A Game of Thrones is 298,000 words, and The Return of the King is 131,000 words.

My excellent editor is currently doing her first round of edits. When she's finished, I'll be editing it one more time, and passing it back to her for the final round. I have already seen some of her work, and I must admit that I'm extremely excited to see the final result of our efforts :). The estimated completion date is September 2015.

What Will I Do with Your Donation?

Most of the funds will be used for your rewards. I would like to hire a professional artist for supplemental artwork such as maps, scene and character illustrations, additional cover art, etc. I truly believe that having good artwork is crucial to the success of the novel. Whatever is left over of the funds would be spent on marketing and other miscellaneous costs including editing. 

Your donations will play a big role in making the novel come alive. And best of all, if I don't meet my campaign goal, you don't spend a dime!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge facing Fierce Winds Rising is marketing. As with any project, people need to know about it before it can succeed. Without a successful marketing effort, fans of fantasy fiction would never hear about my novel.

However, nothing will prevent me from completing the novel. I am determined to release a book that would entertain and inspire readers of fantasy fiction. No matter what happens, I will finish the novel, and it will be available for purchase.

You Don't Need Money to Help

If you want to help, but you just don't have any money to spare, then simply let your friends know about the novel. And if you do, let me know, so that I can give you my thanks.

What's Next?

Fierce Winds Rising is the first book in a series named Tales from the Ersellian Winds. I will start writing the next book in the series immediately after the release of Fierce Winds Rising. I already have lots of ideas, and I can't wait.

However, nothing will prevent me from completing the novel. I am determined to release a book that would entertain and inspire readers of fantasy fiction. No matter what happens, I will finish the novel, and it will be available for purchase.   You Don't Need Money to Help If you want to help, but you just don't have any money to spare, then simply let your friends know about the novel. And if you do, let me know, so that I can give you my thanks.
What's Next?
Fierce Winds Rising is the first book in a series named Tales from the Ersellian Winds. I will start writing the next book in the series immediately after the release of Fierce Winds Rising. I already have lots of ideas, and I can't wait.

story:
Bref résumé

Ces dernières années ont vu la création de plusieurs marques dites régionales mettant à l'honneur le territoire, les origines, la fabrication locale.

Un bref constat nous montre que ces marques ont leur succès mais que le département de l'Ariège fait figure de parent pauvre à ce niveau. En effet, aucune marque n'est là pour représenter notre beau département.

Ce fut le début d'une idée qui s'est transformée en projet. De discussions sans fin, en études de projet nous avons décidé de lancer ce projet nommé LOS ARIEJOS!

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Tel projet si il veut etre lancé correctement demande des capitaux et aprés avoir exploré plusieurs pistes nous avons tranché et décidé que celle du financement participatif était de loin la meilleure.

En effet elle est sans risque pour tout le monde et met en avant la fraternité dont l'absence est typique à notre temps.

Aprés étude nous avons déduit qu'un capital de 4500 euros serait nécessaire pour lancer notre marque. Mais à quoi servira l'argent récolté?

  • La création et l'impression de t-shirts, sweats, sacs etc
  • La création, l'hébergement et la maintenance d'un site internet
  • Une séance de photo en vue de la création d'un catalogue
  • La création et l'impression d'outils de promotion et de communication : catalogue, autocollants, bannières, stand etc
  • La location et l'installation d'un local pour le traitement et l'expédition des commandes

story:
Updating a Relic

My name is Eric Heikkila, and I'm a normal guy - mortgage, wife, child (almost off to college), car payments, etc. Like most people, I have ideas that end up being realized by others because there simply isn't enough time in the day. Now I would like to actually work on an idea I've had that I believe has some merit and would be of interest to others - being able to use a magazine with my Mosin Nagant and not having to worry about getting my thumb smashed loading the firearm.

While doing some searching for ammo for my Mosin Nagant, I came across a 7.62x54R magazine (VEPR). And, like so many others, thought - why is there no way to use this with my Mosin? And so, out came some wood and duct tape . . . 


 . . . followed closely by wood and cardboard and gorilla tape . . . 

. . . with several more prototypes following that:

   

So now, here I am, and I really feel I can make something workable, but I need your help to get there. I have the sketches to make this work and your donations can make this a reality. With your funding we can purchase  several tools to complete my prototype. To start with I may be able to use local DIY shops and rent and shop space, but this being firearms related, many places shy away from allowing these sorts of projects on their premises. So these funds will either go towards a membership to a place that will allow a project of this nature, or purchasing my own tools like a mill, tool and die sets, and a table saw to name a few.

Once we have the tools the next step is testing materials. We will be trying several variations of wood, metal and polymer to get the best fit and function. In the end we may have multiple options or we may find that one material really is the best choice. We can only find out with your help.

Results

The end result will be one or more versions of a fixture that can be put on a Mosin Nagant to allow it to accept a magazine. I plan on adding perks like discounts, early product shipping, special features and possibly custom designs. I'll update this when I figure out some better perks; feel free to contact me with suggestions.
Due to the Terms and Conditions on this website, and the fact that this is an item that would be attached to a firearm, I cannot offer the actual finished product. This is why I will be offering a variety of discounts on the final product.

Timeline

I don't have a solid timeline just yet, since I have a full time job along with other responsibilities, but, depending on the support and interest in this project, I will do my best to make this a reality in the shortest time possible.

Thank You

Even if you can't contribute monetarily, thank you for reading this far, and please share this with others.

story:
Meet the Author and Activist

 

 

Pamela Fortenberry is a newly published author of a children’s watercolor book titled “Still Water” and a dedicated activist and founder of Zero Captivity. Zero Captivity is an organization in support of the movement towards the release of captive Orcas into ocean sanctuaries.

Pam was born in Charleston, South Carolina and grew up in Jacksonville, Florida. She has been married to her wonderful husband Scott for 18 years.  

 

 

The Why of the Story

Holding a living being in captivity is wrong. 

This book is about the injustices of captivity from the perspective of an Orca named Lolita. She has been existing in the Miami Seaquarium for 50 years. The reader will experience Lolita’s journey of being taken from her family and brought to a life of captivity. Still Water passionately reignites the anti-captivity movement and brings a call to action to move captive dolphins and whales into ocean sanctuaries. The book features watercolor paintings from a local and talented artist, Gayle LeCompte. 

 

 

The Focus and Vision 

Pam’s dream is to leave a legacy for future generations, teaching them that it is not right to take something that is not yours, keep it for profit, and never return it. Still Water is going to rewrite the story of captivity and spark hope in the hearts of children, reminding them that their voices matter and that they are capable of creating change. The story is meant to inspire readers, Pam’s hope is that people will join the journey to end captivity.

Through our focus on accurate education, our mission is to empower the widespread release of Orca from captivity into ocean sanctuaries. Our call to action is to accelerate respect for the freedom of all beings in captivity.  Our hope is that future generations become the advocates Orca need; summoning the courage to demand selflessness over amusement and reverse the path to Orca extinction.

 

 

Ways You Can Help

Zero Captivity now and in the future aims to promote education and connection on the widespread release of Orca into ocean sanctuaries. 

Help begins with action. It starts by working together to end captivity. 

Taking the steps to raise awareness, connecting with individuals and organizations with aligned values by speaking up about what we’ve learned will create this change. 

The power greatly relies on reaching the consumers still purchasing tickets. To drive the impact of change they must realize they hold the keys to freedom. 

When presented with the truth, most people will choose the right path. Emotion has clouded our understanding and feelings about Orca in captivity. We’re told performing for food is ‘motivating’ and ‘fun’. The reality is that it’s food manipulation disguised as performance theatre. If we tell children the truth, they will not only understand the cruelty, but they will demand change.

I am Deborah and thank you for considering funding my book project. With over 35 years of martial arts training, instructing, and writing I am passionate about helping others learn to be safe. It is my destiny to help empower others with ways to improve their lives by maintaining a safe environment.

  It starts with the children. Children deserve the right to be educated in a fair, friendly, and safe environment. This book is an opportunity to help parents teach their children how to deal with bullying. Bullying is a serious issue for many students and can lead to suicide. You can help! Monetary contributions can help provide the right method of bullying prevention get to those in need of learning, even surviving social bullying. Other ways to contribute are to help spread the word to those in need of the bullying prevention program contained in my book. You can do this by using the Indiegogo share tools.

   Funds will be used for the editing, publishing, and printing of the completed book. Also, workshops, seminars at schools and churches and other events will be utilized to spread the message of my 4-Level Bullying Prevention System.

  Some great perks have been set up for those contributing to my book project.  Predator Prevention guide, tips on safety, and t-shirts are some of the perks you can find in the funding section.

story:
The story

 

The picture book “Boredom” is a story about a very, unfortunately, very common occurrence in many homes. Neglected children.

Parents are “occupied” with watching television, rowing on mobile phones, surfing on internet, follow politics etc. Main character, a small boy, who is trying to fight with his feelings of boredom, after a few unsuccessful attempts to remove boredom, starts to draw on the wall.

Through a simple way, we touch on parental conscience, pointing out that no expensive toy can replace the time they spend and dedicate to their children.

The idea is to go into a series of picture books describing the feelings of the fear, the anger, the sadness, etc.

We did not even decide which techniques will work better, computer or classical. You have both examples in  the gallery.

Anyhow,

We humbly beg your support for the first book, Boredom.

 

About author:

Frano Petrusa is born in Zagreb, 1977. He is professional illustrator with huge experience in comics, animation and illustration. His comics books “Guerre at match” and “Meilleurs voeux Mostar” are award winning title in France.

story:
Adding illustrations

Hi there! I am the author of Escape from the Crazy Place, a Twine-based Choose-Your-Own-Adventure type story. Escape from the Crazy Place has been in production on and off since it began in manuscript form back in 1984. An interactive round-robin story, it combines the talents of around 20 different authors. Some wrote just a page or two, others wrote dozens. 

Although the original EFtCP manuscript was lost in 1985. I rewrote the book from memory and added four sequels, beginning with Return to the Crazy Place. The number of contributors grew also and by the beginning of the 90's I counted at least thirty, including one whose identity remains a mystery. Most of these contributions survive in one form or another, and the book as it exists today is an amalgam of the best parts of all five episodes. The Twine version is the result of an attempt to finally put the project behind me and move on. 

I want to add pictures as the story grows so it will reach more people, who I hope will be inspired to contribute or even write their own interactive fiction!

Help us commission an artist

  • We'd like to start raising money to pay our fabulous artist, Nick (see above), to create more eye-catching pictures for the interactive fiction.
  • We'd like to continue raising money to hire some other illustrators so the pictures accurately reflect the many facets and contributors to the Crazy Place fiction.
  • If the funds do not reach our goal we'll still be investing in some illustrations and hopefully inspire some people to donate their amateur artwork for their favourite scenes...

Trapping people in Interactive Fiction

  • EftCP has always been a group effort and really we're just trying to get more people trapped forever in a surrealist landscape, never to again see the light of day. It's fun - we promise!
  • We have some illustrators lined up and we're going to keep this going if the goal is reached - as the perks include some new contributors to the pages and therefore more endless corridors for our readers to amble/run down terrified.

Thank you

I would like to thank the following people, without whose contributions, suggestions and enthusiasm Escape From The Crazy Place would not have been possible:

D. & S. Guest, L. Etheridge, D. Mounfield, S. Birch, G. Rushin, M. Lloyd, T. Dalby, J. Caddick, V. Black, S. Harrison, P. Massey, C. Gamble, M. Oswin, F. Sarwar, N. Wragg, G. Turner, The Unknown Contributor, J. Bolet, R. Superfine, J. Infeld, D. Griffiths, D. G. Hughes, M. Bailey and K. M. Sandler.

We'd like to continue raising money to hire some other illustrators so the pictures accurately reflect the many facets and contributors to the Crazy Place fiction.
If the funds do not reach our goal we'll still be investing in some illustrations and hopefully inspire some people to donate their amateur artwork for their favourite scenes...


Trapping people in Interactive Fiction

EftCP has always been a group effort and really we're just trying to get more people trapped forever in a surrealist landscape, never to again see the light of day. It's fun - we promise!
We have some illustrators lined up and we're going to keep this going if the goal is reached - as the perks include some new contributors to the pages and therefore more endless corridors for our readers to amble/run down terrified.


Thank you
I would like to thank the following people, without whose contributions, suggestions and enthusiasm Escape From The Crazy Place would not have been possible:
D. & S. Guest, L. Etheridge, D. Mounfield, S. Birch, G. Rushin, M. Lloyd, T. Dalby, J. Caddick, V. Black, S. Harrison, P. Massey, C. Gamble, M. Oswin, F. Sarwar, N. Wragg, G. Turner, The Unknown Contributor, J. Bolet, R. Superfine, J. Infeld, D. Griffiths, D. G. Hughes, M. Bailey and K. M. Sandler.

story:
THIS BOOK AWESOME AND YOU WILL LOVE IT!

Here's why,

  • Dogs! who doesn't love dogs.
  • Adorable illustrations! Have you seen some of the illustrations on some children's book, some of them ugly and creepy to look at.
  • Second chances and a happy endings! Everybody enjoys a story with a second chance and a happily ever after.
  • Reinforcing children to be responsible! Studies show that teaching responsibility early on helps children to be successful in their school and adult life.
  •  It's a fun story, you wont get tired of reading it over and over to your kiddos. (We locked a few parents in a room and made them read the story for hours. They came out sane or at least as sane as when they were first locked in)

Thank you very much for your interest in My Dog Selena Is Always Running Away.  

Do you have a child or know a child that has been asking for a dog? Do you already have family pet? Do you have a animal lover in your home? Do you want to encourage responsibility? If you do, you need this book in your home. My Dog Selena is Always Running Away is a cute story about a girl and her pup, Selena, who keeps running away. They both love each other a lot, however the girl's carelessness and lack of awareness keeps creating opportunities for Selena to run away. Selena is a very smart dog and always finds her way home so the girl isn't to concerned. She expects Selena to always come back and for everything to be alright except, one day Selena doesn't return home...

 

Responsibility, Animal Safety And More

Studies have showed that teaching responsibility to children early on is key for their success in school and in there adult life.The goal of the book is to entertain, educate, and to encourage the prevention of a beloved house pet from running away. According to the American Humane Association, estimates over 10 million dogs and cats are lost or stolen in the U.S. every year. One in three pets will become lost at some point during their life. To my understanding this is the only children's book about the prevention of losing a dog. 

My Story

My dog, Selena, inspired me to write this book. I adopted Selena from an animal shelter 8 years ago. She's been the greatest dog I've ever had. She is loving and loyal. She never leaves my side, but it wasn't always like this. There was a time when Selena would run away often. I adopted Selena because I lost my leg in the Aurora theater shooting in Colorado. I was not in a good place but Selena saved me. I remember the first week I brought her home I took her for a walk in my wheelchair and she saw a squirrel and she ran away. I didn't know what to do; I sat there for what felt like an hour but then she came back. Another time she ran away was the first time she saw snow.  She kept getting tangled in her leash because she was very excited, so I decided to take her leash off. As soon as her leash was off she ran away. I just stood there, realizing that was a bad idea. It was 20 minutes before she found her way back home. The most recent time Selena ran away was while she was in the backyard. She somehow got through the fence and ran away. I couldn't see her anymore in the backyard so I got ready to drive around and find her. When I opened the door, to my surprise, Selena was taking a nap on our welcome mat.

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP AND WHAT YOU'LL GET FOR IT

While I have written this book and have have commissioned to have it fully illustrated, when you back this project you're really pre-ordering My Dog Selena Is Always Running Away to help me fund my first production run of books. Here are the various rewards can you get for pledging:

(BOOK ILLUSTRATION STILL IN PROGRESS)

Receive over 20 PDF pages of sketched of concept art, drafts, story boards and more. These will be e-mailed to you so you can print them over and over again for your child(ren) to color!

You will receive the following: Digital Concept Art, Audio Book, eBook, ONE Paperback Book, One Hardcover Book, One Art Poster and TEN  Paperback books will be donated to the  Dumb Friends League for TEN families that rescue a pet.

 

$170+ PLEDGE TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE(Hardcover, Dumb friends League)

You will receive the following: Digital Concept Art, Audio Book, eBook, ONE Paperback Book, One Hardcover Book, One Art Poster and TEN  Hardcover books will be donated to the  Dumb Friends League for TEN families that rescue a pet.

POSTER 18"x24" FOR CLASSROOM BUNDLE, PLEDGE TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE AND ADD ON OPTION.

The more you share this campaign, the more backers come in and the more we buff out the book for everyone! Please share the link, let your friends know and use the Indiegogo share tools to push this out to all of your social media outlets.

Thank you! I have the best audience in the world.

Our golden egg stretch goal! At $5k We will create an eBook about what Selena was doing all those times she ran Away. Everybody who pledges will receive a short story eBook about Selena's adventures during the times she ran away.

You will also have our deep gratitude for helping bring this project to life! This book cannot be completed without your support. You can help bring this book into the hands of many children.

The risk we can expect are delays from the manufacturer and shipping. We will keep you posted on any and all delays.

story:
Just hours remain; need 132 more pre-orders for minimum 

One Square Mile Facebook readers Click here to like our page! have been touched deeply by the online stories about the Jewett City few knew, with many moved to tears. Ultimately, this is not just about the borough. The beautiful diversity of people profiled in this full-color, hard-cover book, and the narrative that threads them together, will inspire you to open your eyes to the fascinating lives in the one square mile of your world, wherever you are.

The World in One Square Mile began in 2015 in honor of Jewett City's 120th anniversary and will feature 120 short profiles of people who live, work or visit the one square mile of the borough. It's not a history book. Many of the interviews are spontaneous and on the street; some are planned. The social media campaign will culminate in this coffee table book. (Thank you to our series-long sponsors: United Community & Family Services; Jewett City Savings Bank.)

A portion of the proceeds will be donated to Griswold Pride and its fight against the heroin crisis. The money will be donated in honor of Kevin Drobiak, a 1998 Griswold High School graduate who lost his own battle with addiction but won in life by touching the hearts of many who knew him. His favorite number was 21. (Editor's note: Originally, goal was a donation of $2,100 based on sales of 2,100 books. That goal remains.) 

  • Author Adam Bowles is a 30-year resident of Jewett City who worked for 15 years as a reporter and editor at the Norwich Bulletin, freelanced for such publications at the Connecticut section of The New York Times, and taught journalism at Three Rivers Community College in Norwich for 10 years. 
  • When you pre-order your book today, you will help enhance the reputation of the borough of Jewett City and the town of Griswold by highlighting its people and not just problems. 
  • When you pre-order your book today, it will serve another purpose — the presentation of a united stand against the heroin crisis that has plagued our towns. Too many people in my life, and I'm sure yours, have been devastated by this epidemic, even in this town. 

Dreams as big as the world transcend our boundaries and its nearly 3,500 residents. People battle fears, depression, loss. People raise their families, seek for love, hope for a better tomorrow. We are one square mile of husbands and wives, dads and moms, sons and daughters. We are one square mile of heartache and healing lived out in homes, banks, baseball fields, skateboard parks, pizza parlors, pharmacies, and backyards. Police battle crime. Firefighters keep watch. Chinese live here. Asian Indians live here. Ecuadorians. Haitians. Italians. Black. White. We are one square mile, but we are America and we are the world.

What We Need & What You Get

Buy a book. Enjoy the pre-order-only perks. Boost the borough!

  • The cost to produce the books dramatically drops after orders of  2,000, etc. 
  • Pre-orders will help pay for professional photography, pre-production, production, distribution and equipment. 
  • Pre-orders also help continue the social media project on Facebook, which in itself helps promote Jewett City.

Sample Story — Norman Gileau

Norman Gileau, 86, said he can remember in vivid detail the moment he first saw the girl who would later become his wife — the same woman he cried over this week as she lay in a hospital bed, temporarily disoriented and non-communicative from a series of what is sometimes known as mini-strokes.

"The first time I laid eyes on this girl she was 10 and I was 10," he said from his home of 48 years on Russell Street Friday. "She was this pretty little blonde girl." 

Norma was visiting family across the street from his home in Danielson. Five years later, he saw Norma again while working as an usher at a theater in Danielson. Then, during his senior year at Killingly High School, she moved from New Hampshire into town. Initially, she took a romantic interest in another student, the class president.

"But on graduation night we went in the same car on the way — I remember this like yesterday — to Richard's Dairy in Putnam. From that day on we became a couple," he said. They married in 1952. She has lived at Villa Maria Nursing and Rehab Community in Plainfield the last two-and-a-half months.

Norman retired after 31 years as principal of Griswold High School in 1989. He and his wife have seven children and 18 grandchildren. He laughed when he tried to recall the exact number of great-grandchildren — 8, he said. 

"My family is the best thing that ever happened to me," he said.

In September 2013, his grandson, Trevor Marttila, died at age 20 in a motorcycle accident soon after getting engaged. Trevor, a former Marine, never stopped showing public affection for his grandfather even as an adult. "He'd give me a hug and peck on the cheek," Norman said, choking up with emotion. "He didn't care who was around or who was watching. He was going to do this.

"That kid was so special. You shouldn't say you have a favorite grandson, but to be honest with yourself you do. Even though I love them all." 

Norman described his biggest concern these days.

"It's not about World War III or anything like that," he said. "It's about what is going to happen to all these young people who are involved in chemicals, in heroin. How are they going to achieve happiness?

"Nobody is immune to this," he said, acknowledging that a relative has battled an addiction. 

And then there's his piece of advice for today's generation.

"For kids to honor their parents would be one of the best things they can do," Norman said, although he said many children suffer from absentee parents. "It's one of the commandments, brought down by Moses."

READERS' COMMENTS ON FIRST 42 STORIES:

Jen HardyI have sat here with tears running down my face reading these beautiful stories about real people- real lives. Please keep sharing them, thank you for the people who are willing to share a part of themselves. What a beautiful Square Mile xxx

Deborah Lee Franklin Sally! My lovely neighbor!!!!

Kate Carey-Trull Touching. Hope he follows through, it will be challenging.

Elaine Hagstrom Very nice story. Keep up the great work Bill

Olive Donahue Very interesting

Cynthia Wibberley So nice to hear about the lives of people right here in Griswold!

Goldie Mcphaul Fantastic! So interesting!

Mike Laro What a wonderful story of a Beautiful family! God bless your family!

Maria Desamparada Amazing

Kevin Skulczyck Adam another great story

Ann Sposato Aww...great write up and pic of your beautiful family! So proud of you and your determination Jesse Beck!!

Andrew Brisson Chasing the dream dude, love the write up man, keep it up.

Jasmin Naida Mekic beautiful family

Steven Williamson What a great idea. More towns should do this. I like human interest stories.

April Shorey I saw him this afternoon walking up Ashland street. Wonderful story

Marianne Kurkowski Feuerstein Wonderful story and a wonderful lady....Thank you for all you do...

Wanda Mercado I met Annie at the cancer center! Her spirits were way high,she made my wife feel so good during their sessions. Wonderful woman! God bless. You look great Annie ❤️

"My family is the best thing that ever happened to me," he said.
In September 2013, his grandson, Trevor Marttila, died at age 20 in a motorcycle accident soon after getting engaged. Trevor, a former Marine, never stopped showing public affection for his grandfather even as an adult. "He'd give me a hug and peck on the cheek," Norman said, choking up with emotion. "He didn't care who was around or who was watching. He was going to do this.
"That kid was so special. You shouldn't say you have a favorite grandson, but to be honest with yourself you do. Even though I love them all." 
Norman described his biggest concern these days.
"It's not about World War III or anything like that," he said. "It's about what is going to happen to all these young people who are involved in chemicals, in heroin. How are they going to achieve happiness?
"Nobody is immune to this," he said, acknowledging that a relative has battled an addiction. 
And then there's his piece of advice for today's generation.
"For kids to honor their parents would be one of the best things they can do," Norman said, although he said many children suffer from absentee parents. "It's one of the commandments, brought down by Moses."
