story:
"Beijingerous - A complete guide to adventurous Beijing" is a new, interesting and smart way to explore Beijing.

It is not an ordinary travel book. It is the travel book you've always wanted.

Beijingerous is like your local best friend taking you on an adventure.

It encourages you to experience, taste, learn, and live the local lifestyle during your stay in Beijing.




Learn!

Learn something new every day - Beijingerous is full of interesting, amusing and enlightening facts about Chinese culture. Read actual travel stories and learn from others' experiences. Learn more about habits, pop-culture, food, history, environment, symbols, language and many other interesting topics. Master Chinese eating habits, learn to order food in a hot pot restaurant, surprise your new local friends with slang phrases, haggle with Chinese hand signs and many other cool and useful articles, such as discovering secret meaning of numeric language in China: Did you know that 5201314 in Chinese means "I love you forever?"

Speak!

No matter where in the world you travel you will always experience more when you can speak the same language as the locals. Learning Chinese might be hard if you aren't familiar with "shishishishishi"-poem, let us demostrate a bit:

" Shíshì shīshì Shī Shì, shì shī, shì shí shí shī.
In a stone den was a poet with the family name Shi, who was a lion addict, and had resolved to eat ten lions. "
Beautiful and simple, isn't it?

Beijingerous makes your social situations much easier with not only useful phrases based on actual situations, but also with full spelling help and characters, and an  extremely smart "pointing out pictures"- section! It's a perfect way to communicate for socially awkward travelers!

Experience!

We made several surveys and interviewed tens of people and asked "What would you most want to do on your holiday/while traveling?" Can you guess what was the most answered reply was?

"To experience the culture the way locals see it."

Beijingerous lets you to do things like locals. Instead of focusing fully on crowded tourist attractions it suggests for example...
... to wake up early and head to Ritan park for free Taichi-lessons.
...to get safely lost in Nanluoguxiang hutongs and eat barbecue sticks from street grills.
... to take a night walk around Xidan just for the neon lights.
... to haggle like a pro in a grand morning market in distant East-Beijing.
... to spend a night meeting new people at local English classes in exchange for a Chinese meal.
...to visit famous the Lama Temple to hear ancient Tibetan chanting.
... to travel to rural neighborhoods for breakfast and watch old men playing street chess.
... to walk on a distant part of The Great Wall.

Instead of just giving you address and monotonic descriptions of the locations, it actually suggests how to get there, what you should try and when is the best time to visit. It doesn't teach you history, but it takes you on a cultural adventure.

Beijingerous also gives you various options depending on your budget and bravery! Imagine yourself tasting grilled scorpions on a stick in front of horrified locals... What, did we hear no? Ok, then imagine yourself tasting tanghulu - candied fruits on a stick, how about that?

Live!

You could surely book a fancy hotel in the heart of Beijing, but we encourage you to try alternative options: rent a room at a student community, sleep at a rural side of the town at a local family's house or get a budget hotel just below the Great Wall!
Buy yourself a yikatong and travel cheaper using buses and subways! Get a Chinese mobile prepaid card and surprise your friends with multimedia messages! Beijingerous is full of  life hacks and tips to make your stay at Beijing much easier, cheaper and local!

Beijingerous is a ground-breaking and smart combination of pictured phrases, actual travel stories, interesting culture facts, useful tutorials and hints, not forgetting fully instructed guides to many fascinating attractions and experiences!
- It is all you need to alternatively    experience Beijing like a local!



It all started in 1998.

I was six years old when my godmother took me to the movies to see Disney's Mulan.
It was my first real movie experience and was very exciting. I was dazzled by the beauty of China. It was so colorful, exotic and different than our culture here in Finland. I lost my heart and soul to Chinese culture.

"I lost my heart and soul to Chinese culture right away after seeing Disney's Mulan. And there was no turning back. Ever."

I started to collect Chinese characters in note books and wanted to know everything. At the age of 10 I got my first own Chinese textbooks and started learning Mandarin Chinese. I read lots of books about China and watched many documentaries. I was often bullied in school because back then it was very weird to have such strong interests in odd cultures and languages. I didn't give up though, and kept reading. My biggest dream was to visit China when I was old enough.


Not the culture I was looking for.

I had just celebrated my 18th birthday when I moved to Beijing for a short-term internship. It was like I'd come home. All the pictures and stories from the books I'd read suddenly came alive. I knew the culture so well that it wasn't weird, it felt like  home already on the first day. 

"When I visited Beijing for the first time, I knew the culture so well that it wasn't weird at all. It felt like I was at home."

I visited all the famous tourist attractions on my first days and I must say I was very disappointed. The packed Forbidden City with dozens of similar red houses and dusty relics behind dirty windows was not what I came to see.
Sure, the historic value of The Forbidden City is high, but it wasn't the kind of culture I wanted to experience.

The culture I came for was everywhere else than in the tourist guides. It was in the streets of my neighborhood where old men played street-chess early on Sunday mornings. It was in waiter's smile when I asked for a bath (yù) instead of fish (yú) at small snack bar on the outskirts of town. It was at the Kung-fu lessons my friend took me to at the park. It was at local market halls when I haggled aggressively with a vendor and she laughingly invited me to dinner after furious yelling at each other. It was at all the Chinese lessons I took at windowless skyscrapers - and most importantly, it was at the places I didn't realize to look at without throwing away my tourist guides.

"The packed Forbidden City with dozens of similar red houses and dusty relics behind dirty windows wasn't the Beijing I came to explore. The culture I came for was something I found when I threw away my tourist guides and lived life like a local Beijinger."

I was writing a blog back then about my times in Beijing, and many of the people I knew surprised me by asking if I was writing a book about my travels and travel tips. I started, but never fully finish it due to my busy student life.
I graduated as a graphic designer in 2011 with high grades and a great portfolio. 


Not for the €$¥£, but for the passion.

In 2012 I started my own business as a graphic designer and traveled back to Beijing the next year to meet my new business partners and make my boyfriend's wish come true: to visit China. I also kept writing my blog and my boyfriend told me that I was a truly amazing travel guide. I never thought that way at first - we were at my home.

Early this year I decided to travel back to Beijing and I found my old unfinished book. I saw an opportunity to finish it and maybe even turn my passion of China into something available for everyone. I could help people experience Beijing through local eyes and make visiting the city so much easier.

I know that times are extremely hard for new travel guides, but after dozens of interviews and surveys I realized that the book I've been writing was exactly what people wanted.

Firstly, Beijingerous is not written to make me money. It is made from pure passion and dedication to Chinese culture. All the money we raise together goes to cover the different costs (see "Risks" for more information of funding). If this puts food in my mouth some day, I would be thrilled, but all I really want to see is my book to come alive in your hands and maybe even hear you find the same passion to for Chinese culture and Beijing as I have.

"Beijingerous is not written to make me money. It was written with pure passion and dedication to Chinese culture."

Beijingerous is not exactly a travel guide, per se. It is much more; it is a small encyclopedia of Chinese culture and of Beijing itself. It has travel tips, but is more useful for someone who is going to study, work or live in Beijing, or for someone who is already living in Beijing. It's the guide you've always needed, it is like your local best friend.

At this point, my passion and knowledge hasn't brought me enough money to make my book come alive. Since the book is made for YOU, I need your help.


Let's get the book printed and your adventure in Beijing begin!

- Salla, Tampere 27.6.2015


One of the campaign posters. Download and print one here!



What We Need & What You Get

Our minimum goal is 3800 euros. With 3800 euros we can get 500 printed books, a proper translation and spellcheck, and fund the rest of the SLR camera we need to get high quality pictures and paid perks for you the reader.

WHY 500 PIECES?

500 pieces is considered a good amount for a first self-published book. 500 pieces is what we've counted based on interest and demand on the market right now. All the books which aren't pre-ordered via Indiegogo will be sold online and if demand is met we will print more books. If interest and funding grows we will add additional books to be pre-ordered.

FOR EVERY EXTRA 500€ WE CAN PRINT AN ADDITIONAL 150 BOOKS.



WHY SHOULD YOU FUND US – AND WHAT YOU GET?


PERKS:

Some of you might not have an interest in getting a book so we chose various options for you to show your support! Instead of purchasing the book you can receive gifts from Beijing to explore the city yourself from your sofa... and maybe you'll get excited too! We will get in touch with every donator via email when the campaign is over, so be sure to add us to your e-mail address-book!



*1st/2nd class air mail depending on your country or residence. If you wish to get registered airmail please contact us and we will calculate a shipping price
**During 2.9-3.10.2015. Travel costs are not included, traveling at your own expense.


The Impact


Why should you support us?

In the last year, people have started to emphasizing experiences, even on vacations. Today, the experience as a whole is what's most important. Before, trendy and inexpensive holiday-packs and stays at popular tourist-sites during high-season could sell out in mere days. Today, people want to DIY their vacations and holidays, often casting the traditional travel agencies aside. The growing supply and availability of services provided for travelers by the Internet has also made traveling easier. The modern traveler of today emphasizes the experience and the Spirit of adventure. Many of these experiences are however hidden in places that your average traveler wouldn't know about. Even though the demand for guides like Beijingerous is high, the supply is alarmingly low.

Even though the Internet is good in providing services for travelers as well as an array of tips, people want more tangible material, something the can hold. The growing media-waste has made people lazy in  the sense that using social media and figuring out your internet while on vacation has become a hassle and something people divert from, en masse. Books are almost invariably cited as the most trustworthy sources of information. It's much easier to use a high-quality informational book on the subject than looking for something amidst hours worth of information in hard places when you might not even be sure of what you're looking for. Add to that, that China is the promised land of internet-censorship. It can be very hard and stressful in China when your internet-cable is out for the entire neighborhood and the site that opens effortlessly in your home-country is inaccessible because of the censorship.


Why Beijing?

Instead of writing an opus on the entire country, it's easier as a writer to chose one specific city that people are passionate about throughout the entire publishing process from the big picture to the minute details. 

With us pondering the locations are like-minded local adventurers as well as experts who's interest in the book are the same or greater than that of the reader him- or herself.
These are the origins of the dream-guide of the adventure-seeking traveler ”Beijingerous - A complete guide to adventurous Beijing”.


Beijingerous wants to show the big travel-book publishers what kind of travel guides the traveler of today needs.

This is the optimal time for the adventure-guide. 

We're not forgetting the idea of expanding into a family of books if the first campaign is successful...


Our experience:

Campaigner & Graphic Designer

The campaigner, Salla, has no prior experience with funding campaigns. Instead, the campaigner has a past in, and is experienced in writing blogs, for magazines and marketing; page-layout of magazines, books and various pamphlets; graphic design and entrepreneurship in the same field; four years of studies in photography in art school; as well as the experience of living in Beijing as an exchange-student, learning the culture and the language (see Basics). The campaigner has also designed and published several different ad campaigns for her customers both through her business and freelance. Therefor, the success of this project is foreseeable.

Experts

The various experts and locals in the book are seasoned representatives in their own fields, but not all are known or cited. They are dedicated to their fields or their actions so their accounts and information is trustworthy, informative and factual. These experts are at our use voluntarily and free of charge as opposed to as in the old travel guides where the sponsors or payed adds are cited first - simply because they believe in us. By reading the book you'll learn more about these people!

The Translator

Malin has always been passionate about writing. So much so, that she knew how to write before she could read. Her first languages are Swedish and English, and she is equally strong in both. She's won awards for her poetry, and writes and translates both articles, manuals her own blog and does spell-checking for websites.

When Malin was 19, she moved to Paris to be with her then-boyfriend who was not Parisian and as all Frenchmen, hated all the city stood for. She didn't know anyone, or the language, and spent the first six months struggling. She was on her own from the start, so she went out and learned to know the city and its inhabitants, and her language-skills developed quickly and soon she was fluent to the point that she even spoke French at home. She stayed for four years, and returned to Finland. The call was so strong though, that next she ended up living in America for almost three years very soon after.

"I believe in this project, just as I trust and believe in Salla. This is the kind of book I wished for in the time before the smart-phone, when I walked around the city of Paris with a map and nothing else, knowing no-one and understanding very little. It gets you off the beaten track, takes you places you could only dream of, teaches you things and is an adventure in itself. 

When Salla did me the honor of asking me to translate, I immediately said yes. I think I know Salla well enough that I can keep the integrity of the book, translating Salla's voice and making this accessible to everyone. And after all - this is the kind of guide we've all been waiting for - emphasizing the experience of a city. This is not a book for tourists - it is for travelers."

– Malin, the translator




Risks

Beijingerous is a fixed-funding campaign and has minimum risks. That means, that if we don't meet the minimum funding goal on time; the project will not be funded and all backers get their money back. There are not other hidden costs. Design, photography and art will be provided by the campaigner at zero cost.

The campaigner's travel costs to Beijing are already fully funded and the budget is composed mostly of printing costs and perks. See budget baozi below for full view of charges.




Costs explained:


  • Printing: Approximate printing costs for 500 books with 160 pages each make up the biggest part of the budget, around 1700 euros (including shipping&handling). Printing will be done by trusted long-time business partner and quality is guaranteed with every print. Books will have hard cover and wire binding.
  • Perks: Most expensive part of your perks are shipping costs. We don't want you to have any hidden fees after donating, you get what you donate for - no matter where you live, we deliver (1st/2nd class air shipping, registered airmail must be paid by the donator).
  • Fees: 10% of the budget is going to all different fees. Indiegogo 4%, Paypal 2,9% (+0,30€) and the rest 2-3% is reserved for credit/debit card handling fees via Paypal.
  • Camera: 300€ budget in Indiegogo and rest of the costs campaigner will invest by herself. Camera must be SLR camera. Right now, we only have a generic low-pixel digital camera.  FULLY FUNDED! 300€ of this budget will now used to organize raffle to all contributors!
  • Translation: With only 500€ (omg how generous offer!) will we get this book translated and proof-read by Malin Blomqvist! A tiny part of the budget goes to Chinese proof reader.


Other Ways You Can Help:


SHARE, SHARE, SHARE!


  • Share our campaign on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Tumblr, Pinterest or send it by email to friend!
  • Talk to your friends, family and anyone who will listen!
  • Check our official campaign page on Facebook!
  • If you have a blog or you work at a magazine, feel free to ask us to be interviewed about our project, Chinese culture or pretty much anything that helps us to reach our funding goal!
  • Print out one of our campaign-posters (or all of them?) and post it at your work, at your local store, in your library, in your hallway for the neighbors to see, or if you REALLY get excited about our offer, print out several posters and hand them to your friends and why not to strangers too!



Note to Finnish residents:

Hei! Yleisön pyynnöstä projektiin voi lahjoittaa myös Suomessa toimivalle Nordean tilille. Toivomme kuitenkin ensisijaisesti lahjoittamisen tapahtuvan Indiegogon kautta.

TÄSTÄ LINKISTÄ LÖYDÄT TILINUMERON SEKÄ LOMAKKEEN!

Tililahjoituksesta kehoitamme ystävällisesti täyttämään linkin takaa löytyvän lomakkeen jolloin voimme postittaa valitsemasi edun sekä tarvittaessa palauttaa lahjoittamasi summan tilillesi.

Kaikki rahat tililtä ohjataan suoraan Indiegogoon.

Mikäli projektin rahoitus epäonnistuu olemme yhteydessä sinuun ja rahat palautetaan tilillesi.

Usein kysytty kysymys: Onko kirja englanninkielinen?

Kyllä. Toistaiseksi olemme päätyneet siihen, että rahoituksen keräämisen kannalta parhain vaihtoehto on julkaista Beijingerous kokonaan universaalilla maailmankielellä englanniksi.
Kysynnän ylittäessä tarjonnan tullaan kirjasta painattamaan pienerä myös suomeksi. Lähetämme siinä tapauksessa sähköpostia ja tarjoamme sinulle mahdollisuutta tilata suomenkielisen kirjan englanninkielisen kirjan tilalle.
Mikäli kirjasta ei saada suomenkielistä painosta, yleisön ideoimana tarjoamme kaikille suomenkielisille kirjan tilaajille ilmaiseksi alkuperäispainoksen suomeksi pdf-muodossa.

"Beijingerous - A complete guide to adventurous Beijing" is a new, interesting and smart way to explore Beijing.
It is not an ordinary travel book. It is the travel book you've always 
wanted. Beijingerous is like your local best friend taking you on an 
adventure.It encourages you to experience, taste, learn, and live the local 
lifestyle during your stay in Beijing. 



Learn!
Learn something new every day - Beijingerous is full of interesting, 
amusing and enlightening facts about Chinese culture. Read actual travel
 stories and learn from others' experiences. Learn more about habits, 
pop-culture, food, history, environment, symbols, language and many 
other interesting topics. Master Chinese eating habits, learn to order 
food in a hot pot restaurant, surprise your new local friends with slang phrases, haggle with Chinese hand signs and many other cool and 
useful articles, such as discovering secret meaning of numeric language in 
China: Did you know that 5201314 in Chinese means "I love you forever?"

Speak!
No matter where in the world you travel you will always experience more 
when you can speak the same language as the locals. Learning Chinese might be hard if you aren't familiar with "shishishishishi"-poem, let us demostrate a bit:

" Shíshì shīshì Shī Shì, shì shī, shì shí shí shī.

In a stone den was a poet with the family name Shi, who was a lion addict, and had resolved to eat ten lions. "
Beautiful and simple, isn't it?Beijingerous makes your 
social situations much easier with not only useful phrases based on 
actual situations, but also with full spelling help and characters, and an  extremely smart "pointing out pictures"- section! It's a perfect way to 
communicate for socially awkward travelers!Experience!
We made several surveys and interviewed tens of people and asked 
"What would you most want to do on your holiday/while traveling?" Can you guess 
what was the most answered reply was?

"To experience the culture the way locals see it."
Beijingerous lets you to do things like locals. Instead of focusing 
fully on crowded tourist attractions it suggests for example...... to wake up early and head to Ritan park for free Taichi-lessons. ...to get safely lost in Nanluoguxiang hutongs and eat barbecue sticks from street grills.... to take a night walk around Xidan just for the neon lights.... to haggle like a pro in a grand morning market in distant East-Beijing. ... to spend a night meeting new people at local English classes in exchange for a Chinese meal. ...to visit famous the Lama Temple to hear ancient Tibetan chanting. ... to travel to rural neighborhoods for breakfast and watch old men playing street chess.... to walk on a distant part of The Great Wall.

Instead of just giving you address and monotonic descriptions of the 
locations, it actually suggests how to get there, what you should try
 and when is the best time to visit. It doesn't teach you history, but 
it takes you on a cultural adventure.Beijingerous also gives you 
various options depending on your budget and bravery! Imagine yourself 
tasting grilled scorpions on a stick in front of horrified locals... 
What, did we hear no? Ok, then imagine yourself tasting tanghulu - 
candied fruits on a stick, how about that?
Live!
You could surely book a fancy hotel in the heart of Beijing, but we encourage you to try alternative options: rent a room at a student 
community, sleep at a rural side of the town at a local family's house
 or get a budget hotel just below the Great Wall! Buy yourself a yikatong and travel cheaper using buses and subways! Get a Chinese 
mobile prepaid card and surprise your friends with multimedia messages! 
Beijingerous is full of  life hacks and tips to make your stay at 
Beijing much easier, cheaper and local!


Beijingerous is a ground-breaking and smart combination of pictured 
phrases, actual travel stories, interesting culture facts, useful 
tutorials and hints, not forgetting fully instructed guides to many 
fascinating attractions and experiences!- It is all you need to alternatively    experience Beijing like a local! 



It all started in 1998. I was six years old when my godmother took me to the movies to see Disney's Mulan.It was my first real movie experience and was very exciting. I was dazzled by the beauty of China. It was so colorful, exotic and different than our culture here in Finland. I lost my heart and soul to Chinese culture.
"I lost my heart and soul to Chinese culture right away after seeing Disney's Mulan. And there was no turning back. Ever."
I started to collect Chinese characters in note books and wanted to know everything. At the age of 10 I got my first own Chinese textbooks and started learning Mandarin Chinese. I read lots of books about China and watched many documentaries. I was often bullied in school because back then it was very weird to have such strong interests in odd cultures and languages. I didn't give up though, and kept reading. My biggest dream was to visit China when I was old enough.

Not the culture I was looking for.

I had just celebrated my 18th birthday when I moved to Beijing for a short-term internship. It was like I'd come home. All the pictures and stories from the books I'd read suddenly came alive. I knew the culture so well that it wasn't weird, it felt like  home already on the first day. 
"When I visited Beijing for the first time, I knew the culture so well that it wasn't weird at all. It felt like I was at home."
I visited all the famous tourist attractions on my first days and I must say I was very disappointed. The packed Forbidden City with dozens of similar red houses and dusty relics behind dirty windows was not what I came to see.Sure, the historic value of The Forbidden City is high, but it wasn't the kind of culture I wanted to experience.
The culture I came for was everywhere else than in the tourist guides. It was in the streets of my neighborhood where old men played street-chess early on Sunday mornings. It was in waiter's smile when I asked for a bath (yù) instead of fish (yú) at small snack bar on the outskirts of town. It was at the Kung-fu lessons my friend took me to at the park. It was at local market halls when I haggled aggressively with a vendor and she laughingly invited me to dinner after furious yelling at each other. It was at all the Chinese lessons I took at windowless skyscrapers - and most importantly, it was at the places I didn't realize to look at without throwing away my tourist guides.
"The packed Forbidden City with dozens of similar red houses 
and dusty relics behind dirty windows wasn't the Beijing I came to 
explore. The culture I came for was something I found when I threw away my tourist guides and lived life like a local Beijinger."
I was writing a blog back then about my times in Beijing, and many of the people I knew surprised me by asking if I was writing a book about my travels and travel tips. I started, but never fully finish it due to my busy student life.I graduated as a graphic designer in 2011 with high grades and a great portfolio. 

Not for the €$¥£, but for the passion.

In 2012 I started my own business as a graphic designer and traveled back to Beijing the next year to meet my new business partners and make my boyfriend's wish come true: to visit China. I also kept writing my blog and my boyfriend told me that I was a truly amazing travel guide. I never thought that way at first - we were at my home.
Early this year I decided to travel back to Beijing and I found my old unfinished book. I saw an opportunity to finish it and maybe even turn my passion of China into something available for everyone. I could help people experience Beijing through local eyes and make visiting the city so much easier. 
I know that times are extremely hard for new travel guides, but after dozens of interviews and surveys I realized that the book I've been writing was exactly what people wanted.
Firstly, Beijingerous is not written to make me money. It is made from pure passion and dedication to Chinese culture. All the money we raise together goes to cover the different costs (see "Risks" for more information of funding). If this puts food in my mouth some day, I would be thrilled, but all I really want to see is my book to come alive in your hands and maybe even hear you find the same passion to for Chinese culture and Beijing as I have. 
"Beijingerous is not written to make me money. It was written with pure passion and dedication to Chinese culture."
Beijingerous is not exactly a travel guide, per se. It is much more; it is a small encyclopedia of Chinese culture and of Beijing itself. It has travel tips, but is more useful for someone who is going to study, work or live in Beijing, or for someone who is already living in Beijing. It's the guide you've always needed, it is like your local best friend.
At this point, my passion and knowledge hasn't brought me enough money to make my book come alive. Since the book is made for YOU, I need your help.


Let's get the book printed and your adventure in Beijing begin!


- Salla, Tampere 27.6.2015

  

One of the campaign posters. Download and print one here!

What We Need & What You Get
Our minimum goal is 3800 euros. With 3800 euros we can get 500 printed books, a proper translation and spellcheck, and fund the rest of the SLR camera we need to get high quality pictures and paid perks for you the reader.
WHY 500 PIECES?

500 pieces is considered a good amount for a first self-published book. 500 pieces is what we've counted based on interest and demand on the market right now. All the books which aren't pre-ordered via Indiegogo will be sold online and if demand is met we will print more books. If interest and funding grows we will add additional books to be pre-ordered.

FOR EVERY EXTRA 500€ WE CAN PRINT AN ADDITIONAL 150 BOOKS. 

WHY SHOULD YOU FUND US – AND WHAT YOU GET?





PERKS:
Some of you might not have an interest in getting a book so we chose various options for you to show your support! Instead of purchasing the book you can receive gifts from Beijing to explore the city yourself from your sofa... and maybe you'll get excited too! We will get in touch with every donator via email when the campaign is over, so be sure to add us to your e-mail address-book!

















 *1st/2nd class air mail depending on your country or residence. If you wish to get registered airmail please contact us and we will calculate a shipping price**During 2.9-3.10.2015. Travel costs are not included, traveling at your own expense.
  The Impact
 Why should you support us?
In the last year, people have started to emphasizing experiences, even on vacations. Today, the experience as a whole is what's most important. Before, trendy and inexpensive holiday-packs and stays at popular tourist-sites during high-season could sell out in mere days. Today, people want to DIY their vacations and holidays, often casting the traditional travel agencies aside. The growing supply and availability of services provided for travelers by the Internet has also made traveling easier. The modern traveler of today emphasizes the experience and the Spirit of adventure. Many of these experiences are however hidden in places that your average traveler wouldn't know about. Even though the demand for guides like Beijingerous is high, the supply is alarmingly low.Even though the Internet is good in providing services for travelers as well as an array of tips, people want more tangible material, something the can hold. The growing media-waste has made people lazy in  the sense that using social media and figuring out your internet while on vacation has become a hassle and something people divert from, en masse. Books are almost invariably cited as the most trustworthy sources of information. It's much easier to use a high-quality informational book on the subject than looking for something amidst hours worth of information in hard places when you might not even be sure of what you're looking for. Add to that, that China is the promised land of internet-censorship. It can be very hard and stressful in China when your internet-cable is out for the entire neighborhood and the site that opens effortlessly in your home-country is inaccessible because of the censorship.

Why Beijing?
Instead of writing an opus on the entire country, it's easier as a writer to chose one specific city that people are passionate about throughout the entire publishing process from the big picture to the minute details. 
With us pondering the locations are like-minded local adventurers as well as experts who's interest in the book are the same or greater than that of the reader him- or herself.These are the origins of the dream-guide of the adventure-seeking traveler ”Beijingerous - A complete guide to adventurous Beijing”.


Beijingerous wants to show the big travel-book publishers what kind of travel guides the traveler of today needs.
This is the optimal time for the adventure-guide. 

We're not forgetting the idea of expanding into a family of books if the first campaign is successful... 

Our experience:
Campaigner & Graphic Designer
The campaigner, Salla, has no prior experience with funding campaigns. Instead, the campaigner has a past in, and is experienced in writing blogs, for magazines and marketing; page-layout of magazines, books and various pamphlets; graphic design and entrepreneurship in the same field; four years of studies in photography in art school; as well as the experience of living in Beijing as an exchange-student, learning the culture and the language (see Basics). The campaigner has also designed and published several different ad campaigns for her customers both through her business and freelance. Therefor, the success of this project is foreseeable.
Experts
The various experts and locals in the book are seasoned representatives in their own fields, but not all are known or cited. They are dedicated to their fields or their actions so their accounts and information is trustworthy, informative and factual. These experts are at our use voluntarily and free of charge as opposed to as in the old travel guides where the sponsors or payed adds are cited first - simply because they believe in us. By reading the book you'll learn more about these people!
The TranslatorMalin has always been passionate about writing. So much so, that she knew how to write before she could read. Her first languages are Swedish and English, and she is equally strong in both. She's won awards for her poetry, and writes and translates both articles, manuals her own blog and does spell-checking for websites.
When Malin was 19, she moved to Paris to be with her then-boyfriend who was not Parisian and as all Frenchmen, hated all the city stood for. She didn't know anyone, or the language, and spent the first six months struggling. She was on her own from the start, so she went out and learned to know the city and its inhabitants, and her language-skills developed quickly and soon she was fluent to the point that she even spoke French at home. She stayed for four years, and returned to Finland. The call was so strong though, that next she ended up living in America for almost three years very soon after.

"I believe in this project, just as I trust and believe in Salla. This is the kind of book I wished for in the time before the smart-phone, when I walked around the city of Paris with a map and nothing else, knowing no-one and understanding very little. It gets you off the beaten track, takes you places you could only dream of, teaches you things and is an adventure in itself. 

When Salla did me the honor of asking me to translate, I immediately said yes. I think I know Salla well enough that I can keep the integrity of the book, translating Salla's voice and making this accessible to everyone. And after all - this is the kind of guide we've all been waiting for - emphasizing the experience of a city. This is not a book for tourists - it is for travelers."– Malin, the translator


   Risks 

Beijingerous is a fixed-funding campaign and has minimum risks. That means, that if we don't meet the minimum funding goal on time; the project will not be funded and all backers get their money back. There are not other hidden costs. Design, photography and art will be provided by the campaigner at zero cost.
The campaigner's travel costs to Beijing are already fully funded and the budget is composed mostly of printing costs and perks. See budget baozi below for full view of charges.







Costs explained:

Printing: Approximate printing costs for 500 books with 160 pages each make up the biggest part of the budget, around 1700 euros (including shipping&handling). Printing will be done by trusted long-time business partner and quality is guaranteed with every print. Books will have hard cover and wire binding.

Perks: Most expensive part of your perks are shipping costs. We don't want you to have any hidden fees after donating, you get what you donate for - no matter where you live, we deliver (1st/2nd class air shipping, registered airmail must be paid by the donator).
Fees: 10% of the budget is going to all different fees. Indiegogo 4%, Paypal 2,9% (+0,30€) and the rest 2-3% is reserved for credit/debit card handling fees via Paypal.

Camera: 300€ budget in Indiegogo and rest of the costs campaigner will invest by herself. Camera must be SLR camera. Right now, we only have a generic low-pixel digital camera.  FULLY FUNDED! 300€ of this budget will now used to organize raffle to all contributors!

Translation: With only 500€ (omg how generous offer!) will we get this book translated and proof-read by Malin Blomqvist! A tiny part of the budget goes to Chinese proof reader.



  Other Ways You Can Help:
SHARE, SHARE, SHARE!

Share our campaign on your Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Tumblr, Pinterest or send it by email to friend!
Talk to your friends, family and anyone who will listen!

Check our official campaign page on Facebook!

If you have a blog or you work at a magazine, feel free to ask us to be interviewed about our project, Chinese culture or pretty much anything that helps us to reach our funding goal!


Print out one of our campaign-posters (or all of them?) and post it at your work, at your local store, in your library, in your hallway for the neighbors to see, or if you REALLY get excited about our offer, print out several posters and hand them to your friends and why not to strangers too!





Note to Finnish residents:
Hei! Yleisön pyynnöstä projektiin voi lahjoittaa myös Suomessa toimivalle Nordean tilille. Toivomme kuitenkin ensisijaisesti lahjoittamisen tapahtuvan Indiegogon kautta.

TÄSTÄ LINKISTÄ LÖYDÄT TILINUMERON SEKÄ LOMAKKEEN!

Tililahjoituksesta kehoitamme ystävällisesti täyttämään linkin takaa löytyvän lomakkeen jolloin voimme postittaa valitsemasi edun sekä tarvittaessa palauttaa lahjoittamasi summan tilillesi.
Kaikki rahat tililtä ohjataan suoraan Indiegogoon.
Mikäli projektin rahoitus epäonnistuu olemme yhteydessä sinuun ja rahat palautetaan tilillesi.
Usein kysytty kysymys: Onko kirja englanninkielinen?
Kyllä. Toistaiseksi olemme päätyneet siihen, että rahoituksen keräämisen kannalta parhain vaihtoehto on julkaista Beijingerous kokonaan universaalilla maailmankielellä englanniksi.Kysynnän ylittäessä tarjonnan tullaan kirjasta painattamaan pienerä myös suomeksi. Lähetämme siinä tapauksessa sähköpostia ja tarjoamme sinulle mahdollisuutta tilata suomenkielisen kirjan englanninkielisen kirjan tilalle.Mikäli kirjasta ei saada suomenkielistä painosta, yleisön ideoimana tarjoamme kaikille suomenkielisille kirjan tilaajille ilmaiseksi alkuperäispainoksen suomeksi pdf-muodossa.

Short Summary

The book is written and 17 of the 27 chapters have been illustrated.
______________________
Through the experience of sharing my children's joy of camping, I have created the ultimate camping adventure book, 27 pages, written in rhyme, with a full illustration on each page. The language is both lyrical and conceptually imaginative. Here's an excerpt from the first morning to get the idea:

''While creatures roam in the light of the moon, she’s kept safe in a butterfly cocoon. There she hides until the faint lights of dawn, like tiny candles behind curtains drawn. Counting the shadows of birds on the tent, she reflects on how night was spent. There’s something quite cozy in morning light, like love reaching out through the sense of sight.''

The story follows a little girl through an adventure with a group of children who discover the mystery behind what has been stealing their pretty little things while they sleep at night. The story takes them along a trail of lost toys and into a cave where they find their own lost treasure:

“Shiny harmonica and silver flute! Now I’m sure it’s pirate loot! Olivia whispers, “It’s beautiful! but also quite unusual. The treasure wouldn’t seem peculiar if it weren't so very familiar.”

For more excerpts of the book, please email me a request at robert@zenbiotic.com

My name is Robert Duffy, the writer of Trail of Toys. I have vetted a handful of wonderful illustrators with skills in lighting effects and fantastical settings in nature. I have also contacted a self publishing company that has affordable prices on low runs with significant cost savings for volume.

What We Need & What You Get

I hope to raise $1,500 for the following:

$1250 for 50% of the illustration cost for 10 illustrations.

$250 Graphic designer to put the the book together.

____________________________________________________

Each donor of $50 gets an illustrated page in their honor with a personalized message printed on the illustration such as, "for my daughter, Mary", plus a hardcover copy.

Each donor of $25 gets a personalized hardcover copy signed by Olivia and other characters in the book.

All other donors can get a hardcover book for cost + shipping less the amount donated.

____________________________________________________

Send as a gift or donate to the local library.

The Impact

I'm combining nature and poetry in a way that is fun and educational. At the end of the book, there will be a section introducing rhyming and poetry. I hope to compel children to make their own poetry and to see the world through a different lens of conceptual thinking and imaginative images through poetry.

Risks & Challenges

The book is written! But there are still some minor hurdles. We are consulting with a children's book editing professional to make sure the story is as taut as it can be. If revisions are necessary, we will amend them in the second edition for the second print run. We have 17 chapters illustrated and two illustrators ready to continue work on the project right now. Once the book is ready, 100 copies will be printed and sent to each donor.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you love camping or know people with children who do, please help spread the word.

story:
Local and regional journalism is in financial trouble and under attack. That means we're all in trouble. Do you know what your elected officials are doing? If you don’t, how can you keep them accountable? Studies are showing governments are less efficient and more corrupt when the people see less of what they’re doing. And it’s not just government, either.

The Briefing

For people in Idaho, The Idaho Weekly Briefing helps. We have been reporting for many years about Idaho’s governments, business and other organizations, and the demographic and other changes sweeping the state. Our reports and analysis, some original and some curated from source documents, are packaged in an e-magazine 40 to 50 pages in length. Easy to scan quickly or read in depth.

You can see samples of the Briefing (recent copies in pdf) at http://www.ridenbaugh.com/index.php/weekly-briefings/

I'm Randy Stapilus, editor and publisher. I’ve been reporting about Idaho for more than 40 years, as a newspaper editor and reporter, writing books and editing periodicals about the state. My weekly column runs in newspapers serving Boise to Lewiston to Pocatello.

The Idaho Weekly Briefing is read by legislators, activists, government and business leaders, and interested citizens, has always been sustained by subscription fees. We're launching this campaign to make the Weekly Briefing free of charge, freely available, through e-mail or download. No paywall, no ads, no subsidiary income stream.

What we're looking for

We need $6,000 to underwrite the next year's Briefings - just enough keep the Briefing going free-access, for 52 issues.

But we hope to go beyond that, to continue into the future ... and make the Briefing more than it is now. We want to add features, news and investigative articles from writers around the state, mid-week updates, and much more. The more funding we receive, the more we can do.

As another organizer on IndieGoGo said about their effort, "This campaign is about so much more than money. It's about community - because success requires a backing of people who believe that it's possible, and want to be a force in making it happen."

We see the Idaho Weekly Briefing is a prototype. If we can make it work in Idaho ... with you as a contributor as well as a supporter ... it could inspire more efforts around the country. We want to be a part of that, and I’m asking you to become a part of it too.

story:
Proyecto KYOU KARA ORE WA LOLI NO HIMO [ESPAÑOL]

El propósito de este proyecto es apoyar la traducción de novelas ligeras al español profesional. Seguro ya están hartos de leer un montón de incoherencias linea a linea en esas fast-novels que tanto abundan en Internet. 

¿Qué harán con el dinero?

Cubrir los costos de la traducción. Tiempo que el traductor destinará para acabar el proyecto. Recordemos que es una persona que se está alzando en este mundo emergente de las novelas ligeras. También se debe cubrir la maquetación de la novela para quienes deseen tenerla en formato físico. Los formatos digitales serán Epub y pdf. Quienes apoyen el proyecto recibirán de manera anticipada estás últimas dos versiones. 

¿El traductor... sabe traducir?

El traductor ha trabajado de manera independiente a lo largo de los años en traducción de episodios de anime, películas y otros materiales referentes al mundo del anime. Podemos dar fe de su trayectoria y de la calidad de su trabajo. 

¿Me meteré en problemas por apoyar este proyecto?

No. Todo el contenido de la novela está en regla. Por lo menos, el autor original de la novela Akatsuki Yuki y su ilustrador Henreader no están tras las rejas ni tienen procesos legales abiertos xd.

¿Por qué debería apoyar este tipo de proyectos?

Hasta hace poco las editoriales sentían miedo en entrar en este mundo de las novelas ligeras, pero debido al éxito que vino con los mangas licenciados y el fandom del anime en toda hispanoamerica, es importante que desde ya comencemos a apoyar a estos traductores para que se unan a las filas de traductores y logren hacernos llegar más de estas obras fascinantes que hasta ahora sólo podíamos conseguir en japón. 

¿Riesgos?

Más que riesgos, el único inconveniente sería un retraso por porte del traductor. Pero esperamos tener listo el volumen en unos 6 meses. Por eso es importante el apoyo constante. Si logramos cumplir la meta el Traductor tendrá todas las herramientas y garantías necesarias para completar el proyecto. 

Finalmente, esperamos todo tu apoyo y cualquier aporte será bienvenido.
story_txt:
Proyecto KYOU KARA ORE WA LOLI NO HIMO [ESPAÑOL]
El propósito de este proyecto es apoyar la traducción de novelas ligeras al español profesional. Seguro ya están hartos de leer un montón de incoherencias linea a linea en esas fast-novels que tanto abundan en Internet. 

¿Qué harán con el dinero?
Cubrir los costos de la traducción. Tiempo que el traductor destinará para acabar el proyecto. Recordemos que es una persona que se está alzando en este mundo emergente de las novelas ligeras. También se debe cubrir la maquetación de la novela para quienes deseen tenerla en formato físico. Los formatos digitales serán Epub y pdf. Quienes apoyen el proyecto recibirán de manera anticipada estás últimas dos versiones. 
¿El traductor... sabe traducir?
El traductor ha trabajado de manera independiente a lo largo de los años en traducción de episodios de anime, películas y otros materiales referentes al mundo del anime. Podemos dar fe de su trayectoria y de la calidad de su trabajo. 
¿Me meteré en problemas por apoyar este proyecto?
No. Todo el contenido de la novela está en regla. Por lo menos, el autor original de la novela Akatsuki Yuki y su ilustrador Henreader no están tras las rejas ni tienen procesos legales abiertos xd.

¿Por qué debería apoyar este tipo de proyectos?
Hasta hace poco las editoriales sentían miedo en entrar en este mundo de las novelas ligeras, pero debido al éxito que vino con los mangas licenciados y el fandom del anime en toda hispanoamerica, es importante que desde ya comencemos a apoyar a estos traductores para que se unan a las filas de traductores y logren hacernos llegar más de estas obras fascinantes que hasta ahora sólo podíamos conseguir en japón. 

¿Riesgos?
Más que riesgos, el único inconveniente sería un retraso por porte del traductor. Pero esperamos tener listo el volumen en unos 6 meses. Por eso es importante el apoyo constante. Si logramos cumplir la meta el Traductor tendrá todas las herramientas y garantías necesarias para completar el proyecto. 
Finalmente, esperamos todo tu apoyo y cualquier aporte será bienvenido.

story:
My daughter is 7 years old. 

She came home from school one day and sat down with to tell me a story. The story is called Bella the Vampire and spins a tale about a 5 year old who is bitten by a vampire and turns into one herself. I have been looking for an illustrator to do the cover and interior files for cheap or free, and I was unable to find any. Every day she asks me when her book will be here, and I really want to get it done for her. She has a speech impediment, which makes learning to read hard for her. I want to advocate learning for children and so does she. Each child in her class will receive a free copy of her book. Pre-K through first grade classes will receive one book free per class in her school as well as a copy donated to it library. Each elementary school in my school district will also have a copy donated to their library. The story is full of site words the kids have to learn. I think it would be a fun way for them to grow in their education by reading her story.

story:
SuomenHuomen -hankkeen käynnistävä joukkorahoituskampanja
 

(In English: see below)

Haluaisitko olla mukana luomassa uudenlaista yhteiskunnallista vaikutuskanavaa?

Haluamme aidosti hyödyntää digitalisaation ja yhteiskunnallisen ilmapiirin muutokset. Haluamme aistia heikkoja signaaleja ja tarjota ahaa-elämykset myös lukijoille tavalla,

- josta löytyy sosiaalisen median dynaamisuus, debatti ja dialogi, mutta ilman huutoa ja ylilyöntejä?

- jossa suomenkielinen sisältö on tarjolla kaikille ilmaiseksi, mutta kuka tahansa pääsee pientä maksua vastaan vaikuttamaan siihen, mistä kirjoitetaan seuraavaksi?

Laita tutkivat journalistit ja tiedonnälkäiset toimittajat selvittämään aiheita, joita itselläsi ei ole aikaa penkoa! Tämän mahdollistaa luomamme VIP-lukijajärjestelmä, jonka kautta voit haluamallasi summalla vaikuttaa seuraavaksi käsiteltävien aiheiden valintaan. Esimakua saat tästä joukkorahoituskampanjasta, mutta jatkossa VIP-lukijat pääsevät suoraan ehdottamaan myös omia aihealueitaan.

- jossa laaja-alaisin taustoin valikoidut keskustelijat tuovat oman näkökulmansa ajankohtaisiin aiheisiin terävästi, mutta älyllisen keskustelun hengessä?

- jossa on tarjolla myös perinteisen median kaltainen toimitettu uutis- ja artikkelisisältö?

Suomenkielisen sisällön lisäksi tarjoamme kansainväliselle yleisölle englanniksi tietoa pohjoisen Itämeren alueesta (Suomi, Ruotsi, Viro) erityisesti turvallisuuden ja yhteiskunnallisten kysymysten saralla. Jatkuva uutisseuranta taustoituksineen vastaa niin alueella toimivien yritysten, bisnesmahdollisuuksista kiinnostuneiden, asioita työkseen seuraavien toimittajien, analyytikoiden ja tutkijoiden kuin kiinnostuneiden kansalaistenkin tiedontarpeeseen kaikkialla maailmassa.

Verkkojulkaisun yhteyteen perustetaan ajatuspajaverkosto, jonka kautta niin yksityisen, kolmannen sektorin kuin julkisten tahojenkin toimijat saavat mahdollisuuden kerätä syventävää tietoa haluamistaan aihepiireistä.

Hankkeen tekijät ovat vapaudennälkäisiä, innokkaita ja omaavat journalistista, tiedotuksellista ja muuta tarvittavaa kokemusta tavoitteen läpiviemiseksi. Työvoimaintensiivisyys ja sosiaalisen median osaamisen yhdistäminen perinteisen uutismediaan, sekä yhteiskunnallinen tiedonjano ovat voittoreseptimme ainekset, joilla anglosaksinen ja länsimaisen mediakulttuurin lipunkantaja erottuu muista.
 

Päätoimittajasta


Pekka Virkki (s. 1993) on tätä nykyä Helsingissä asuva toimittaja ja vapaa kirjoittaja. Virkki on suorittanut alemman korkeakoulututkinnon Tallinnan yliopistossa (BA of Social Sciences) pääaineenaan oikeustiede. Hän on  kirjoittanut runsaasti muun muassa Verkkouutisiin sekä Suomen Sotilas -lehteen. Kansainvälisistä julkaisuista hänen tekstejään ovat julkaisseet muun muassa ukrainalainen Euromaidanpress sekä kanadalainen UpNorth Magazine. Lisäksi Virkki on toimittanut kaksi yhteiskunnallisiin aiheisiin keskittyvää kirjaa sekä toiminut viestintäkonsulttina.

Päätoimittajana aloittavaa herraa tuttavat kuvailevat suorasanaiseksi, mutta analyyttiseksi ja hyvin argumentoivaksi. Monipuoliset verkostot ja lähdekriittisyys takaavat luotettavan tiedonsaannin ja -käsittelyn sekä pidempien kehityskaarien ymmärryksen silloinkin, kun muut säntäävät suuna päänä tekemään nopeita johtopäätöksiä katsoen ainoastaan seuraavan päivän tilannetta ja muistaen pelkän eilisen. Oikeassa ei toki ole aina Virkkikään, vaan myöntää reilusti, jos arviot menevät osoitetusti pieleen.

Vapaa-aikanaan avopuolisonsa kanssa asuva 25-vuotias Virkki viihtyy erityisesti gastronomian, musiikin ja kaupunkikävelyiden parissa.

Hanketta ovat auttaneet suunnitelmia kommentoimalla muun muassa seuraavat henkilöt:

Saana Jokinen
Turvallisuusanalyytikko (erikoistumisalueita Lähi-itä ja Turkki), toimittaja

Marcus Kolga
Päätoimittaja, UpNorth Magazine

Mikko Laakso
Viestintäkonsultti, KTM

Jaakko Puuperä
Päätoimittaja, Suomen Sotilas

Janne "Rysky" Riiheläinen
Viestintäyrittäjä

Alpo Rusi
Suurlähettiläs emeritus, vieraileva professori (Vytautas Magnus -yliopisto, Kaunas, Liettua)

Juha Särestöniemi
Johtajuuskonsultti

Tarmo Virki
Toimittaja

Kutakin artikkelia voi rahoittaa haluamallaan summalla aina kahdesta eurosta tuhanteen euroon. Artikkelit julkaistaan verkkolehdessä ja toteutetaan siinä laajuudessa kuin kunkin saama rahoitus yleisöltä indikoi kiinnostuksen määrää. Hyvin paljon rahoitusta keränneet jutut saatetaan jakaa artikkelisarjaksi.

Halutessaan rahoittaja saa nimensä julkiseen tukijalistaan.

Lähetämme kaikille yhteystietonsa antaneille myös sähköpostitse kirjallisen sertifikaatin, jossa näkyvät rahoitetut artikkelit ja niihin käytetty summa. Mikäli haluttuja artikkeleita ei ole spesifioitu ("donations"), jaetaan summa tasan kaikkien artikkelien tuotantoon. Hinnat (ml. "donations") sisältävät vastikkeellisina korvauksina myös arvonlisäveron (24%).

Lue lisää artikkeliaiheista >>

Facebook >>

Twitter >>
 

Participate in the crowdfunding of WestronWynde!


We provide valuable information on security, society, politics, economy and weekly hot topics in the Northern Baltic Sea region, especially Sweden, Finland, and Estonia. We promote pro­-western values, liberal democracy, and objectivity.

We go deeper than other media outlets: it is not only about the news, but a thorough background analysis on topical issues is where we excel. Since you may not have the time to learn about the procedures of the Swedish parliament or about Finnish political history, we bring all the must­-knows in English directly to your mobile device. You will find our reports updated on our magazine-­like website.

News flow is for free. To gain access to all of our articles, you're charged a reasonable, monthly fee. However, it is a small price to pay for a businessman, entrepreneur, journalist, analyst, researcher, decision­-maker, civil society activist or anyone who wants to know what is happening in the region. You will also have our networks at your disposal in case you need special reporting or contacts, our think tank is there for you.

The internet publication ­- WestronWynde -­ will be launched at the end of the summer or beginning of the autumn of 2018.
 

Editor­-in-­Chief


Pekka Virkki (b. 1993) is a freelance journalist living in Helsinki. His articles have appeared in several Finnish and foreign news outlets and magazines, such as Verkkouutiset and UpNorth. He has also edited and published two books and worked as a media consultant.

Virkki holds a BA of Social Sciences from Tallinn University, with law as his major subject.

The following persons ­among many others ­ have contributed to the project by planning/providing useful feedback:

Saana Jokinen
Security analyst (specialized in the Middle East and Turkey), journalist

Marcus Kolga
Editor-in-Chief, UpNorth Magazine

Mikko Laakso
Entrepreneur

Jaakko Puuperä
Editor-in-Chief, Finnish Soldier Magazine

Janne "Rysky" Riiheläinen
Media entrepreneur

Alpo Rusi
Former Ambassador, Visiting Professor (Vytautas Magnus University, Kaunas, Lithuania)

Juha Särestöniemi
Management consultant

Tarmo Virki
Journalist

You can fund each article with an amount from €2 to €1,000. The published articles will be as detailed depending on their funding and based on our readers' preferences – without a paywall. Well­-funded articles may be divided into two or three parts.

Every funder will receive a certificate for funding sent by email. When it is not specified which articles are funded the amount will be divided among all of them. All prices (incl. "donations" as such unspecified purchases) include VAT (24%).

Read more about the article topics >>

Facebook >>

Twitter >>

story:
Where did this idea come from? 

Growing up I lived on a beautiful funny farm. On that farm my father raised show chickens, of which he let me help take care. I loved helping him with those chickens, everyday in my backyard was a boy's paradise where I could imagine whatever I wanted as I played with the chickens and our dog. 

During an extremely rough patch in my childhood my father pulled me to our incubators. (If you don't know what this is, it is a replacement for the hens so you can hatch more chicks.) He told me I could name one of the chicks who was hatching and it would be mine to take care of. I didn't know it that day but I would spend the next few years hanging out in the backyard with that chicken who would become my best friend. His name was sunshine and I would sit and read with him, throw him on my shoulder to go and fight off bad guys, and sit and meditate with him about life. It was in these many moments I had with my best friend that I learned that I shouldn't be afraid to be me like sunshine wasn't afraid to be scruffy and a human boy's best friend. Now as a father, I re-called all these feelings when reading to my son, and that's when something screamed in my head "You need to share sunshine!"

Me & Sunshine Reading

Finding a collaborator...

 The story of sunshine is no ordinary story. Yes it is the classic story of a boy and his bird, but it goes much deeper than that. This story needed to be memorable and to do that it needed a great illustrator. While joining every Facebook group on writing children's books I could get my hands on. I never thought I would be able to find the perfect fit as quick as I did. In late January when I had completed writing my story I posed a question to one Facebook group I had just joined asking "Are there any illustrators on here?" In a flash i received many messages from illustrators, but none of them felt right. But then I got the message from Zohreh, a new and upcoming artist who was seeking her first illustration opportunity. 

After receiving tons of messages earlier I was not hopeful, but something told me to just see and ask her for a quick sketch of what she could do. When i asked for this sketch I only expected a pencil sketch, Zohreh went above and beyond that! TWICE! I said no to the first one just because I was nervous, and she then asked if she could try again. I let her try again, and I did not regret it! She went above and beyond again and completely amazed myself and my wife. I didn't wait a second more, I asked her to be the illustrator of which I am happy to say she said yes to. 

Zohreh has been amazing to work with through out this project and I can't wait to get her illustrations out into the world. Because of her I know this book will draw children and adults into its pages and story. I would suggest paying attention to her, she is going to go far.

First Sketch Sent 

Second Chance Sketch

What is the schedule? 

On January 25, 2019 Zohreh began work on the Cover for Sunshine. This has been completed and work has progressed to individual illustrations of each page. These should be completed by the end of March 2019. April will be dedicated to assembly of the book, including but not limited to: text layout, author and illustrator biographies, final editing, etc. Upon completion the book will be printed through KDP on Amazon. We will start by printing 300 copies at the size of 8.5 x 11.5 and looking into possible hardcover copies. The books will be ready to distribute by June 2019. We are committed to self-publishing currently and are proud of what we have done so far. Zohreh and I are new in the industry and taking it one  step at a time. So far everything has been smooth sailing. 

What is our budget?

We are asking for $6,000.00, to fund the book. Approximately $5,000.00, is for the book design, printing, and shipping 300 copies. The left over $1000.00, will be used towards the 5-8% Indiegogo fee and printing costs for rewards. If we should exceed our target, please continue donating!!! Extra funds will be used towards taxes, packaging for shipping, travel and expenses for our next book. 

Page 2 of Book

What are our long term-goals? 

Before I even wrote this book I decided It should have more books with Sunshine as the lead character learning how to understand others, being friends with those who are different from us and overcoming failure...each would bring more friends from the funny farm into the story and teach children the value in being kind to others and overcoming obstacles. With the success of this book we hope to find an agent and partner with a reputable publishing company. Query's will be sent out this summer. 

Risks & Challenges...

The process and industry of self publishing are new to us. But so far we have worked well together and know with the help of our editor we will find success. We are committed to overcoming any obstacle and challenges that may arise through the process. We are 110% committed to the success of this book. Thank you again for all your support in helping us accomplish the success of this book!

In closing...

Thank you for taking time to read and learn more about our book campaign! We hope you'll either back us, wish us luck and or share our campaign with your family and friends. I hope you will share the excitement we have for teaching children to shine and be who they are to help make a difference in this world. Without the support of family and friends this wouldn't be possible. THANK YOU!
