We’re creating an interactive, responsive website that will have all the tools that you would need to start your own “Canadian Icons Project” – right in your own community.This Local Icons Project will give all Canadians the resources to share their local Icons on our website. Participants will be able to submit photographs, brief interviews and tell stories about people in their communities who are doing iconic deeds. If you have a community leader in your neighbourhood that's really changed things for the better, we'd like to be able to help you highlight them! Share their story with the rest of Canada on our website! Think of it as a national grassroots mentorship program - where Canadians from coast to coast can support and learn from each other's iconic contributions!
At $900 000 - We already have over 100 videos filmed and ready to be edited! The Icons in these videos explore Canada through their own perspective, as they talk about their careers, social issues, the past, present, and future of Canada. We need your support to get those first 100 videos ready for the big screen!
At $1 000 000 - Many of the Canadians we want to include in this project can’t come to our Toronto studio, so we have to go to them! We really want to get more French Canadians in our project, and that can only happen if we travel to Montreal! 
At $1  200 000 - Once we photograph and film interviews with the final 50 Icons, we will need to get those photos edited and videos cut and ready for the big screen too! Help us complete all of the videos for our project!
At $1 450 000 -  We already have all of the resources ready to do all of the editing, now we just need the stars! There are some Iconic Canadians who are extremely well-known on the big screen! The only way we'll get these Iconic Canadians into our project is if we travel to where they are - Los Angeles! Help us to get our crew and equipment over to L.A., so that we can photograph and interview some of Canada's most recognizable faces!

At $1 550 000 - We want to kick off this project with a bang! The launch party will be an exhibition of all the Icon portraits where you can meet the entire Canadian Icons team and even some of the icons. You can win a ticket to the launch party by winning our referral contest, or by purchasing the perk once the stretch goal is unlocked!
      This project will act as an educational archive of 150 Canadian Icons· Help bring Canadians together to celebrate our Sesquicentennial· Help define our Canadian Identity· Create an educational resource for everyone to learn about Canada· Show Canada for the land of opportunity that it is· To help create a thread that will run through communities and tie them              together· To inspire pride and understanding in all Canadians
 Our challenge is the logistics - we have one year to meet our deadline of July 1st 2017. In that year, we will be arranging Icon interviews, which includes traveling to Icons who are out of our reach. After that, it's producing all materials - including video editing, photo retouching and writing and translation for the book. That's a lot of work for a year - but with your help, we can do it! We appreciate any kind of support! Here are some more ways that you can help!· Send us a video of yourself saying Happy Anniversary Canada! Or Happy Sesquicentennial Canada! Or just talk about what you love about Canada!· Tell us who you think should be a Canadian Icon on our facebook page! We value your opinion!· Share our project with your friends and family!

story:
The 2016 Kampot Writers & Readers Festival explores themes of 'Peace, Freedom, and Prosperity’ (Santiphap, Seripheap, Pheap Roungrueng) and marks the 25th anniversary of the Paris Peace Accords.  The Paris Peace Accords were signed on October 23, 1991 and marked the official end of the Cambodian–Vietnamese War.

This year's festival will take place in Kampot, Cambodia, from 3-6 November, 
•    With almost 50 events spanning 5 nights, with more than 2500 people attending
•    Cultural workshops
•    Multi-lingual sessions.
•    Writers, artists and performers from Cambodia and around the world
•    The largest celebration of literacy, arts & culture along the Mekong

 “The Kampot Writers & Readers Festival is sure to be an inspiring event, not only for the people of Cambodia but for all of us who recognize the great cultural contributions of the Cambodian people, who greatly admire their courage and resilience after so much anguish and suffering, and who care deeply about their fate. I join with many others around the world to wish you the greatest success in this exciting endeavor, and the many more that will follow as Cambodia regains its rightful place in global culture.”
– Noam Chomsky

"It is my vision to support artists. It is their culture, their soul, their ancestors' culture - we need to engage young people in the arts, and give them an opportunity to make a living while keeping their culture alive - this festival is about coming together to support artists to do just that."
– Arn Chorn Pond – Founder Cambodian Living Arts


What We Need & What You Get
We’re calling on supporters to become KWRF festival friends by choosing any one of the following:
•    $30 listing in program credits (print and website) or private donation


•    $50 1 x KWRF T-shirt + program listing


•    $100 KWRF Festival Friend membership card plus KWRF ‘goodies bag’ 
- for local pick-up in Kampot or Phnom Penh exc T-shirt.


•    $150 KWRF Festival Friend membership card plus KWRF ‘goodies bag’ 
- including T-shirt and international postage.

*** KWRF goodies tote bag includes Kampot’s famous gourmet organic Kampot Pepper, original 25cm x 15cm handmade screen print by Sticky Fingers Art Prints Cambodia, a limited edition 7inch vinyl record by The Cambodian Space Project, magazines, KWRF print program, VIP tickets to KWRF opening and closing events. 

“Kampot is the perfect place for it,” says Poulson. “It has always had a diverse community; it’s a far-flung place beyond the pale, and even beyond the reach of the central authorities right up until the 1920s, it's always [Kampot] been considered someplace else. It’s a former pirate port, it’s got an uber-cool vibe and a community made up of cultural and linguistic diversity: Cham, Chinese, travellers. It has the French colonial history and the contemporary history. Now the arts and culture community is converging for this event.”

–Julien Poulson AsiaLIFE Oct 2016

story:
On Apple Watch

My name is Sam Hutchings, and since I got my first computer 20 years ago I have been obsessed with technology and the way it can change our lives. For the last 10 years I have been thinking, talking and writing on-and-off about technology and how it has impacted us.

In 2007, I launched bitcolumns.com, a tech site with a simple goal: deliver unbiased tech reviews to young people and students across the world, with a focus on budget-conscious users. Fast forward to 2015, and that's changed a bit. Bitcolumns is now a Medium publication where a select few share commentary and thoughts on Apple and the world around them. Some of our pieces have had up to 11 thousand views with a 100% read rate.

The aim of this campaign is to get you, my friends and fellow Apple lovers, involved with my Apple Watch reviews and content. I'd love to review it, and I think many of you would love to read my thoughts on it, but I am not pally enough with Apple to get a review unit. I need to buy my own.

By supporting this campaign, you are part of bitcolumns history. I am considering this both an experiment and a great way to get you, my friends and community, involved.

What I Need & What You Get

To pre-order an Apple Watch Sport review unit and fly to the UK to pick it up, I need to raise about £500. (I looked at shipping the Watch to Spain. It's about the same price and takes longer than if I just fly to the UK to get it). To be able to devote time to writing and bringing the thoughts to you, I need to raise another £500.

If I raise more, I'll be able to  deliver more reviews and thoughts on more Apple products now and in the future. (New MacBook reviews and thoughts, anyone?)

If you contribute at one of the following levels, you'll get access to the associated perk:

£1 - Thank You! Everybody who contributes at this level or above will get a thank you in a published "Thank you" piece.

£5 - Thank You! (with link). Exactly like the £1 perk, but your name on the "Thank You!" page will be linked to whatever social handle or web page you like (within reason).

£20 - Personalised Thank You! A personalised thank you from yours truly, including your name and a link to your social handle or website. There's a limited number of these available. 

£300 - Article Sponsor. You'll sponsor a specific article within the collection. A mention and link to your site or product, or you, will be put at the beginning and the end of an article. If you have an Apple Watch product or app, this level gets you an article covering your product (you'll have to provide a code for the app or the product, of course). There's a limited number of these available.

£1,000 - Collection Sponsor. You'll get a mention as sponsor on every piece of Apple Watch content created as part of this campaign. This will include the "First Day Thoughts", "A Week with Apple Watch" and "A Month on My Wrist" pieces. There's only one of these available.

If the goal is not met, the collection of articles will have to be delayed until the extra funds can be found to get an Apple Watch on my wrist.

The Impact

By backing this campaign you make this become a reality. I will be able to write up my thoughts on and experiences with Apple Watch and publish them for bitcolumns on Medium. 

Risks & Challenges

There are two big risks for this project.

1) We don't hit the goal, meaning this won't happen. No money will change hands.

2) Apple sells out of the Apple Watch ridiculously quickly. This would push back the timeframe for the article collection, as I wait for the device to be delivered.

If we don't meet the goal, the project isn't funded. This is an all or nothing endeavour.

I've been writing about technology for about 10 years now. You can see what I've written recently at https://medium.com/bitcolumns-medium or follow me on twitter at @smutchings.

If you like the idea of this campaign, and the experimental nature of it, I hope you'll consider backing it. It means a lot to me.

And even if you can't back this yourself, you can help a lot by sharing it on your favorite social networks or anyone else you know who you think might be interested.

story:
Abstract: 
Leire, an attractive woman in her late twenties, who earns her life as a professional ethical hacker in Madrid, discovers by chance a classified document that reveals that the worst terrorist attack in the history of her country, did not happen as the official statement said.

Determined to get to the bottom to reveal the true, she will find the unexpected help of a policeman serving in the BIT: a special unit of the National Police Corps established to fight cyber criminals committing computing crimes.
Together, hacker and policeman will try to clarify the facts around those infamous days of 2004, when the train bombings happened in Madrid, while at the same time they will be trying to stop a new and imminent threat hovering over the city:  Zayan, a lone-wolf with barely nothing to lose, is planning to commit a new terrorism act against the transportation network of their beloved city.
May a pair of computer geeks reveal the truth and prevent the death of hundreds of people?
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

What is all this about? 

If you are motivated by spy histories, tales of hackers who use actual hacking techniques, high technology, action and electricity, then you might like this techno-thriller, and I am asking for your help.

I need to gather some money, so I can finish this novel, get it out of my mind, and give birth to it. Geeks out there, please help me. You should certainly enjoy the reading.

Why do I need the money?

1) In order to reach a greater audience, I am writing this novel in English, although my mother tongue is Spanish, so I will be making mistakes that I do not want to pass to the published version of the novel.

For that reason I will hire a professional editor, which is not cheap, in order to help me with the final revision of the document. The novel will be published both in English and Spanish.

2) Also I am planing to make a printed version of the book. For that reason I will need to hire a professional designer to perform the final document layout.

What is the current status of the writing?

I am almost finishing the first draft of the book, and I think that the result is quite interesting. If you are into techno-thrillers, spies, hackers and cyberpunk subculture, you will definitely enjoy the reading and I urge you to collaborate. Any help will make a difference.

story:
Hi, everyone! I’m Eva, a 28-year-old girl from Slovenia. I own a company called EVING, which provides digital services such as graphic design, web development, photography, etc. I’m just a regular person with an idea to combine different stories by people from all around the world in one book – a very funny and exciting book everyone would love to read.

How did I get this idea for a book that introduces real-life stories by people from all over the world? Well, one day I was doing practically nothing – I was sitting in a swinging chair behind our holiday home, surrounded by nature. I started to think about my life, reminisce about certain events… So I remembered the first time I drove a car. My dad was sitting in the passenger seat, teaching me how to shift gears, steer the wheel, and so on. When I shifted into second gear and reached 20 km/h (12 mp/h), I was so very nervous. I said to myself, “Wow, what speed! I’m driving so fast!” Now, having accumulated 5 years of driving experience, I just laugh when I remember my excitement over going 20 km/h (12 mp/h). My experience of driving a car for the first time isn’t something I would like to publish in this book, but it certainly got me thinking that there must be millions of people around the world with even more exciting stories to tell about their first time doing something. And this was definitely something I was interested in and would have loved to read about right then and there. So I thought – what if I’m not alone? What if there are other people who would also be interested in reading these kind of stories? What if there’s a way I could publish a book with lots of different stories, all connected by one common thread, which is doing something for the first time? Would people be interested? Well, with the help of this IndieGoGo campaign, I can be certain of one thing at least: if there are enough pre-orders for the book, I can make it happen. If I reach my goal of $29,000, I will have enough funding to make this project go worldwide. If I don't reach the goal, contributors get all their money back - this campaign is set for fixed funding.

 

The main expense I have to consider in publishing the book are authors’ exclusive license fees. Every author whose story will be published in My First Time will receive $50 for the license to distribute their story. Since the book will contain 200 stories, this amounts to $10,000, a sum that would be impossible to cover without this funding campaign.

The second biggest expense is editing the book. Selecting the most interesting stories out of thousands, proofreading the selected stories, etc. This cost cannot be adequately evaluated, because the number of submitted stories won’t be known until 31 May 2017 (if funding is successful), which is the predicted submission deadline. I estimate that $8,500 will be needed for this very important part of publishing the book.

A sum of $7,000 is estimated for the printing and free shipping (in the USA) of 800 books. If there are more pre-orders than the planned 800, even better. Since the main distribution of the books will take place in the USA, I have discovered a way to distribute the books there at a low cost (shipping from the EU is very expensive). There is one catch to it, though: I cannot print hardcover books, only laminated paperbacks. This subject is still open for discussion – if there are many more pre-orders for the book than initially expected, I think I can somehow find a way to also print a hardcover edition of the book for the same amount of money as was first raised by this campaign.

The rest of the money will be used for promoting the project on social media, for the campaign fee, and for a contingency plan, should it need to be put in effect, i.e., should any unpredicted expenses arise. As I already mentioned, my expertise is graphic design, so I will take care of the book’s look and feel, design its cover, the accompanying webpage, etc. One expense less to worry about.

 

To all of my backers, who will support me and help me bring my idea to life, I will provide FREE SHIPPING of the book (in the continental US). Don’t miss our “early bird” pre-orders and save 25%.

A special edition of the book with 50 additional stories (e-book) will also be available for a limited period of time to those who will believe in me and help me the most.

A special hardcover edition with a personal thank you note and free delivery to anywhere in the world will be available only with the Special edition pack. You will also receive the biggest thank you among all the contributors, and will be acknowledged inside every printed book and e-book, on the webpage, and on the Facebook page.

We provide reseller packs for bookstores and other retailers who would like to invest in larger quantities of books and save up to 50%. Don't hesitate to check out all of our perks on this page.

 

Read some of the first stories that have been submitted by people from Slovenia and see what kind of reading material you can expect inside the book. It is not yet clear if any of these sample stories will be published in the final book, since not enough stories have been submitted for comparison at this point in the project timeline. We will choose only 200 of the most exciting, intriguing, and funny stories for publication.

 

Author privacy guaranteed. Since the book will include only true real-life stories, I realize that some authors, those who don’t want everyone to know about their first-time experience of something, won’t like to be named, at least not by their real name. Authors can therefore also opt for a pseudonym. Their e-mail addresses will be safely stored in our database and won’t be made available to the public.

Project success. I believe this project could be very successful if done right, if we publish stories that will entice as many people as possible. They say experiences enrich a person, which is also true of first-time experiences. This book will contain 200 different stories of first-time experiences by people from all around the world.

Take a trip down memory lane and remember when you first experienced the same kind of thing as the author of one of these stories. It’s in our human nature to be curious about other people’s lives and to compare ourselves to them. That’s why I think this book could make it big.

Risks and challenges. Like in any other funding campaign, there are certain risks that I must consider. The biggest risk is that not enough stories will be submitted if this campaign reaches its goal. But I will solve this problem with Facebook ads and other advertising campaigns, so that people from all over the world will learn about my project. As I noticed in the past two weeks, people from Slovenia were very much interested not only in reading about other people’s experiences, but also in writing their own stories.

 

Do you have an opinion on My First Time that you would like to share with the world? I’d be very happy to see you participate in my project, share your opinion, offer suggestions on how to improve the project, suggest additional perks, etc. Your opinion matters.

Would you like to write your own story? If I reach the goal set for this project, I will be looking for authors who would like to share funny stories of their first-time experiences. Read more about story submissions and the terms and conditions that apply on the book’s website at www.my-first-time-book.com.

Please spread the word and help me reach my goal.

A special edition of the book with 50 additional stories (e-book) will also be available for a limited period of time to those who will believe in me and help me the most.

A special hardcover edition with a personal thank you note and free delivery to anywhere in the world will be available only with the Special edition pack. You will also receive the biggest thank you among all the contributors, and will be acknowledged inside every printed book and e-book, on the webpage, and on the Facebook page.

We provide reseller packs for bookstores and other retailers who would like to invest in larger quantities of books and save up to 50%. Don't hesitate to check out all of our perks on this page.

 

Read some of the first stories that have been submitted by people from Slovenia and see what kind of reading material you can expect inside the book. It is not yet clear if any of these sample stories will be published in the final book, since not enough stories have been submitted for comparison at this point in the project timeline. We will choose only 200 of the most exciting, intriguing, and funny stories for publication.

 


Author privacy guaranteed. Since the book will include only true real-life stories, I realize that some authors, those who don’t want everyone to know about their first-time experience of something, won’t like to be named, at least not by their real name. Authors can therefore also opt for a pseudonym. Their e-mail addresses will be safely stored in our database and won’t be made available to the public.
Project success. I believe this project could be very successful if done right, if we publish stories that will entice as many people as possible. They say experiences enrich a person, which is also true of first-time experiences. This book will contain 200 different stories of first-time experiences by people from all around the world.
Take a trip down memory lane and remember when you first experienced the same kind of thing as the author of one of these stories. It’s in our human nature to be curious about other people’s lives and to compare ourselves to them. That’s why I think this book could make it big.
Risks and challenges. Like in any other funding campaign, there are certain risks that I must consider. The biggest risk is that not enough stories will be submitted if this campaign reaches its goal. But I will solve this problem with Facebook ads and other advertising campaigns, so that people from all over the world will learn about my project. As I noticed in the past two weeks, people from Slovenia were very much interested not only in reading about other people’s experiences, but also in writing their own stories.

 

Do you have an opinion on My First Time that you would like to share with the world? I’d be very happy to see you participate in my project, share your opinion, offer suggestions on how to improve the project, suggest additional perks, etc. Your opinion matters.
Would you like to write your own story? If I reach the goal set for this project, I will be looking for authors who would like to share funny stories of their first-time experiences. Read more about story submissions and the terms and conditions that apply on the book’s website at www.my-first-time-book.com.
Please spread the word and help me reach my goal.

Are you ready to be a part of my revolution?

Does customer no-service need to return to customer service?

Then my new book “Unconventional Customer Service: How-to Break the Rules in Providing Unparalleled Service” is the book that needs to, and must, be published!

 

This book is based on my 34 years of customer service experience and needs to be read by anyone who provides, manages, OR trains customer service people.

 

The money will be used to publish (print, e-book, and audio) and publicize this revolutionary idea of customer service for today’s world and economy.

It will revolutionize customer service to literally everyone…if the companies are ready for such innovative and unique ideas!

So I ask again:

Are you ready to be a part of my revolution?

If so donate today!

Thank you very much and watch for the title soon

story:
Summary

The Maseru Mail is a literary magazine in newspaper format (the print edition, compact size) but will also be published digitally online. In its literary endeavours, The Mail aims to build a bridge–to inspire a cultural exchange–between Lesotho, Southern Africa and the rest of the world. The Mail’s print edition will be published in Maseru and distributed in various metropolitan areas in a few countries in Southern Africa whereas the paper’s digital edition aims to reach a wider audience throughout the world.

The Team

We are a group of young artists–writers, journalists, filmmakers, illustrators, photographers–from Lesotho, South Africa, Zimbabwe, Germany, the UK and the United States. Seeing that our team is made up of individuals coming from vastly different cultural backgrounds, it is evident therefore, that the goal is to exchange ideas through art and literature, and hopefully expand by engaging other contributors from countries different from the ones mentioned above.

The Reason we are asking for help

The funds will go towards the cost of printing–at Paarl ColdSet Printers in the city of Johannesburg, where some of the best publications, such as YOU magazine and the Mail&Guardian are printed–and then building a better web platform.

Samples

 

Samples: A cover and  an article in section B–taken from the inaugural issue of the paper: 

If you aren’t able to Support us at this time:

 

If you are not able to support this initiative right away, we understand, but would you happen to have a friend, an acquaintance, a brother or a sister, a colleague that you think might be interested in this? Please go ahead and tell them.

story:
Welcome and thank you for your interest in this book and our campaign. The book "Diction" by author Kelly Larsen has been completed and is ready for distribution. This is why we have set up this campaign. We are looking for $5,000.00 to help us be production ready and to build up a small inventory to begin distribution of Kelly's book. We also need to add some things like another binding machine and production ready printer and supplies (Paper, Ink, Blank CD's, and blank usb's just to name a few) for the first production run .

We have a number of Perks listed here please look them over and pick the one that fits you best. There is much to choose from.

No matter the amount we raise all funds will go to fulfilling the perks to each contributor and right into production of this book, and the hardware and supplies listed above.

This book is unlike anything you may have read before. It is very unique in it's substance and it's presentation as a book and a workbook as well. You will be challenged to Read, Digest, And Grow with the author and the content she has provided. Everyday English words are broken open to reveal a unique meaning that will challenge you and inform you as to some basic Spritual Truths. If you are ready for something different and unique then this book is for you.

We wish to share with you that as the book has been finished and is ready for distribution there is very little risk to you the contributor. When this campaign is finished every contributors perk will be fulfilled within 4 - 6 weeks after the campaqign ends and we receive funds into our account. 

We are currently able to produce this book in all the formats offered here just in very small quantities which is why we have instituted this campaign. 

If you simply are unable to donate but wish to help us in other ways we ask you to spread the word about this project and use the share tools provided by this Indiegogo campaign to engage others and share in our excitement about this book "Diction".

There will be more updates and information as the campaign moves forward. 

From all of us at MKI Studios

Thank you for time and interest !
